00064 /** Ops for strategy callout */
00065 enum ccn_strategy_op {
00066     CCNST_NOP,      /* no-operation */
00067     CCNST_FIRST,    /* newly created interest entry (pit entry) */
00068     CCNST_TIMER,    /* wakeup used by strategy */
00069     CCNST_SATISFIED, /* matching content has arrived, pit entry will go away */
00070     CCNST_TIMEOUT,  /* all downstreams timed out, pit entry will go away */
00071 };

00153 /**
00154  * Frequency of wrapped timer
00155  *
00156  * This should divide 1000000 evenly.  Making this too large reduces the
00157  * maximum supported interest lifetime, and making it too small makes the
00158  * timekeeping too coarse.
00159  */
00160 #define WTHZ 500U
00161 
00162 /**
00163  * Name of our unix-domain listener
00164  *
00165  * This tiny bit of global state is needed so that the unix-domain listener
00166  * can be removed at shutdown.
00167  */
00168 static const char *unlink_this_at_exit = NULL;
00169 
00170 static void
00171 cleanup_at_exit(void)
00172 {
00173     if (unlink_this_at_exit != NULL) {
00174         unlink(unlink_this_at_exit);
00175         unlink_this_at_exit = NULL;
00176     }
00177 }
00178 
00179 static void
00180 handle_fatal_signal(int sig)
00181 {
00182     cleanup_at_exit();
00183     _exit(sig);
00184 }
00185 
00186 /**
00187  * Record the name of the unix-domain listener
00188  *
00189  * Sets up signal handlers in case we are stopping due to a signal.
00190  */
00191 static void
00192 unlink_at_exit(const char *path)
00193 {
00194     if (unlink_this_at_exit == NULL) {
00195         static char namstor[sizeof(struct sockaddr_un)];
00196         strncpy(namstor, path, sizeof(namstor));
00197         unlink_this_at_exit = namstor;
00198         signal(SIGTERM, &handle_fatal_signal);
00199         signal(SIGINT, &handle_fatal_signal);
00200         signal(SIGHUP, &handle_fatal_signal);
00201         atexit(&cleanup_at_exit);
00202     }
00203 }
00204 
00205 /**
00206  * Check to see if the unix-domain listener has been unlinked
00207  *
00208  * @returns 1 if the file is there, 0 if not.
00209  */
00210 static int
00211 comm_file_ok(void)
00212 {
00213     struct stat statbuf;
00214     int res;
00215     if (unlink_this_at_exit == NULL)
00216         return(1);
00217     res = stat(unlink_this_at_exit, &statbuf);
00218     if (res == -1)
00219         return(0);
00220     return(1);
00221 }

00223 /**
00224  * Obtain a charbuf for short-term use
00225  */
00226 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00227 charbuf_obtain(struct ccnd_handle *h)
00228 {
00229     struct ccn_charbuf *c = h->scratch_charbuf;
00230     if (c == NULL)
00231         return(ccn_charbuf_create());
00232     h->scratch_charbuf = NULL;
00233     c->length = 0;
00234     return(c);
00235 }
00236 
00237 /**
00238  * Release a charbuf for reuse
00239  */
00240 static void
00241 charbuf_release(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct ccn_charbuf *c)
00242 {
00243     c->length = 0;
00244     if (h->scratch_charbuf == NULL)
00245         h->scratch_charbuf = c;
00246     else
00247         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00248 }

00277 /**
00278  * Looks up a face based on its faceid (private).
00279  */
00280 static struct face *
00281 face_from_faceid(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid)
00282 {
00283     unsigned slot = faceid & MAXFACES;
00284     struct face *face = NULL;
00285     if (slot < h->face_limit) {
00286         face = h->faces_by_faceid[slot];
00287         if (face != NULL && face->faceid != faceid)
00288             face = NULL;
00289     }
00290     return(face);
00291 }
00292 
00293 /**
00294  * Looks up a face based on its faceid.
00295  */
00296 struct face *
00297 ccnd_face_from_faceid(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid)
00298 {
00299     return(face_from_faceid(h, faceid));
00300 }
00301 
00302 /**
00303  * Assigns the faceid for a nacent face,
00304  * calls register_new_face() if successful.
00305  */
00306 static int
00307 enroll_face(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face)
00308 {
00309     unsigned i;
00310     unsigned n = h->face_limit;
00311     struct face **a = h->faces_by_faceid;
00312     for (i = h->face_rover; i < n; i++)
00313         if (a[i] == NULL) goto use_i;
00314     for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00315         if (a[i] == NULL) {
00316             /* bump gen only if second pass succeeds */
00317             h->face_gen += MAXFACES + 1;
00318             goto use_i;
00319         }
00320     i = (n + 1) * 3 / 2;
00321     if (i > MAXFACES) i = MAXFACES;
00322     if (i <= n)
00323         return(-1); /* overflow */
00324     a = realloc(a, i * sizeof(struct face *));
00325     if (a == NULL)
00326         return(-1); /* ENOMEM */
00327     h->face_limit = i;
00328     while (--i > n)
00329         a[i] = NULL;
00330     h->faces_by_faceid = a;
00331 use_i:
00332     a[i] = face;
00333     h->face_rover = i + 1;
00334     face->faceid = i | h->face_gen;
00335     face->meter[FM_BYTI] = ccnd_meter_create(h, "bytein");
00336     face->meter[FM_BYTO] = ccnd_meter_create(h, "byteout");
00337     face->meter[FM_INTI] = ccnd_meter_create(h, "intrin");
00338     face->meter[FM_INTO] = ccnd_meter_create(h, "introut");
00339     face->meter[FM_DATI] = ccnd_meter_create(h, "datain");
00340     face->meter[FM_DATO] = ccnd_meter_create(h, "dataout");
00341     register_new_face(h, face);
00342     return (face->faceid);
00343 }
00344 
00345 /**
00346  * Decide how much to delay the content sent out on a face.
00347  *
00348  * Units are microseconds. 
00349  */
00350 static int
00351 choose_face_delay(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, enum cq_delay_class c)
00352 {
00353     int micros;
00354     int shift;
00355     
00356     if (c == CCN_CQ_ASAP)
00357         return(1);
00358     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_MCAST) != 0) {
00359         shift = (c == CCN_CQ_SLOW) ? 2 : 0;
00360         micros = (h->data_pause_microsec) << shift;
00361         return(micros); /* multicast, delay more */
00362     }
00363     return(1);
00364 }
00365 
00366 /**
00367  * Create a queue for sending content.
00368  */
00369 static struct content_queue *
00370 content_queue_create(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, enum cq_delay_class c)
00371 {
00372     struct content_queue *q;
00373     unsigned usec;
00374     q = calloc(1, sizeof(*q));
00375     if (q != NULL) {
00376         usec = choose_face_delay(h, face, c);
00377         q->burst_nsec = (usec <= 500 ? 500 : 150000); // XXX - needs a knob
00378         q->min_usec = usec;
00379         q->rand_usec = 2 * usec;
00380         q->nrun = 0;
00381         q->send_queue = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00382         if (q->send_queue == NULL) {
00383             free(q);
00384             return(NULL);
00385         }
00386         q->sender = NULL;
00387     }
00388     return(q);
00389 }
00390 
00391 /**
00392  * Destroy a queue.
00393  */
00394 static void
00395 content_queue_destroy(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_queue **pq)
00396 {
00397     struct content_queue *q;
00398     if (*pq != NULL) {
00399         q = *pq;
00400         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&q->send_queue);
00401         if (q->sender != NULL) {
00402             ccn_schedule_cancel(h->sched, q->sender);
00403             q->sender = NULL;
00404         }
00405         free(q);
00406         *pq = NULL;
00407     }
00408 }

00410 /**
00411  * Close an open file descriptor quietly.
00412  */
00413 static void
00414 close_fd(int *pfd)
00415 {
00416     if (*pfd != -1) {
00417         close(*pfd);
00418         *pfd = -1;
00419     }
00420 }
00421 
00422 /**
00423  * Close an open file descriptor, and grumble about it.
00424  */
00425 static void
00426 ccnd_close_fd(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid, int *pfd)
00427 {
00428     int res;
00429     
00430     if (*pfd != -1) {
00431         int linger = 0;
00432         setsockopt(*pfd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER,
00433                    &linger, sizeof(linger));
00434         res = close(*pfd);
00435         if (res == -1)
00436             ccnd_msg(h, "close failed for face %u fd=%d: %s (errno=%d)",
00437                      faceid, *pfd, strerror(errno), errno);
00438         else
00439             ccnd_msg(h, "closing fd %d while finalizing face %u", *pfd, faceid);
00440         *pfd = -1;
00441     }
00442 }
00443 
00444 /**
00445  * Associate a guid with a face.
00446  *
00447  * The same guid is shared among all the peers that communicate over the
00448  * face, and no two faces at a node should have the same guid.
00449  *
00450  * @returns 0 for success, -1 for error.
00451  */
00452 int
00453 ccnd_set_face_guid(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face,
00454                    const unsigned char *guid, size_t size)
00455 {
00456     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00457     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00458     struct ccn_charbuf *c = NULL;
00459     int res;
00460     
00461     if (size > 255)
00462         return(-1);
00463     if (face->guid != NULL)
00464         return(-1);
00465     if (h->faceid_by_guid == NULL)
00466         return(-1);
00467     c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00468     ccn_charbuf_append_value(c, size, 1);
00469     ccn_charbuf_append(c, guid, size);
00470     hashtb_start(h->faceid_by_guid, e);
00471     res = hashtb_seek(e, c->buf, c->length, 0);
00472     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00473     if (res < 0)
00474         return(-1);
00475     if (res == HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
00476         face->guid = e->key;
00477         *(unsigned *)(e->data) = face->faceid;
00478         res = 0;
00479     }
00480     else
00481         res = -1;
00482     hashtb_end(e);
00483     return(res);
00484 }
00485 
00486 /**
00487  * Return the faceid associated with the guid.
00488  */
00489 unsigned
00490 ccnd_faceid_from_guid(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00491                       const unsigned char *guid, size_t size)
00492 {
00493     struct ccn_charbuf *c = NULL;
00494     unsigned *pfaceid = NULL;
00495     
00496     if (size > 255)
00497         return(CCN_NOFACEID);
00498     if (h->faceid_by_guid == NULL)
00499         return(CCN_NOFACEID);
00500     c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00501     ccn_charbuf_append_value(c, size, 1);
00502     ccn_charbuf_append(c, guid, size);
00503     pfaceid = hashtb_lookup(h->faceid_by_guid, c->buf, c->length);
00504     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00505     if (pfaceid == NULL)
00506         return(CCN_NOFACEID);
00507     return(*pfaceid);
00508 }
00509 
00510 /**
00511  * Append the guid associated with a face to a charbuf
00512  *
00513  * @returns the length of the appended guid, or -1 for error.
00514  */
00515 int
00516 ccnd_append_face_guid(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct ccn_charbuf *cb,
00517                       struct face *face)
00518 {
00519     if (face == NULL || face->guid == NULL)
00520         return(-1);
00521     ccn_charbuf_append(cb, face->guid + 1, face->guid[0]);
00522     return(face->guid[0]);
00523 }
00524 
00525 /**
00526  * Forget the guid associated with a face.
00527  *
00528  * The first byte of face->guid is the length of the actual guid bytes.
00529  */
00530 void
00531 ccnd_forget_face_guid(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face)
00532 {
00533     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00534     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00535     const unsigned char *guid;
00536     int res;
00537     
00538     guid = face->guid;
00539     face->guid = NULL;
00540     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->guid_cob);
00541     if (guid == NULL)
00542         return;
00543     if (h->faceid_by_guid == NULL)
00544         return;
00545     hashtb_start(h->faceid_by_guid, e);
00546     res = hashtb_seek(e, guid, guid[0] + 1, 0);
00547     if (res < 0)
00548         return;
00549     hashtb_delete(e);
00550     hashtb_end(e);
00551 }
00552 
00553 /**
00554  * Generate a new guid for a face
00555  *
00556  * This guid is useful for routing agents, as it gives an unambiguous way
00557  * to talk about a connection between two nodes.
00558  *
00559  * lo and hi, if not NULL, are exclusive bounds for the generated guid.
00560  * The size is in bytes, and refers to both the bounds and the result.
00561  */
00562 void
00563 ccnd_generate_face_guid(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, int size,
00564                         const unsigned char *lo, const unsigned char *hi)
00565 {
00566     int i;
00567     unsigned check = CCN_FACE_GG | CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE;
00568     unsigned want = 0;
00569     uint_least64_t range;
00570     uint_least64_t r;
00571     struct ccn_charbuf *c = NULL;
00572     
00573     if ((face->flags & check) != want)
00574         return;
00575      /* XXX - This should be using higher-quality randomness */
00576     if (lo != NULL && hi != NULL) {
00577         /* Generate up to 64 additional random bits to augment guid */
00578         for (i = 0; i < size && lo[i] == hi[i];)
00579             i++;
00580         if (i == size || lo[i] > hi[i])
00581             return;
00582         if (size - i > sizeof(range))
00583             range = ~0;
00584         else {
00585             range = 0;
00586             for (i = i; i < size; i++)
00587                 range = (range << 8) + hi[i] - lo[i];
00588         }
00589         if (range < 2)
00590             return;
00591         c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00592         ccn_charbuf_append(c, lo, size);
00593         r = nrand48(h->seed);
00594         r = (r << 20) ^ nrand48(h->seed);
00595         r = (r << 20) ^ nrand48(h->seed);
00596         r = r % (range - 1) + 1;
00597         for (i = size - 1; r != 0 && i >= 0; i--) {
00598             r = r + c->buf[i];
00599             c->buf[i] = r & 0xff;
00600             r = r >> 8;
00601         }
00602     }
00603     else {
00604         for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
00605             ccn_charbuf_append_value(c, nrand48(h->seed) & 0xff, 1);
00606     }
00607     ccnd_set_face_guid(h, face, c->buf, c->length);
00608     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00609 }
00610 
00611 /**
00612  * Clean up when a face is being destroyed.
00613  *
00614  * This is called when an entry is deleted from one of the hash tables that
00615  * keep track of faces.
00616  */
00617 static void
00618 finalize_face(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
00619 {
00620     struct ccnd_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(e->ht, NULL);
00621     struct face *face = e->data;
00622     unsigned i = face->faceid & MAXFACES;
00623     enum cq_delay_class c;
00624     int recycle = 0;
00625     int m;
00626     
00627     if (i < h->face_limit && h->faces_by_faceid[i] == face) {
00628         if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED) == 0)
00629             ccnd_face_status_change(h, face->faceid);
00630         if (e->ht == h->faces_by_fd)
00631             ccnd_close_fd(h, face->faceid, &face->recv_fd);
00632         if ((face->guid) != NULL)
00633             ccnd_forget_face_guid(h, face);
00634         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->guid_cob);
00635         h->faces_by_faceid[i] = NULL;
00636         if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED) != 0 &&
00637               face->faceid == ((h->face_rover - 1) | h->face_gen)) {
00638             /* stream connection with no ccn traffic - safe to reuse */
00639             recycle = 1;
00640             h->face_rover--;
00641         }
00642         for (c = 0; c < CCN_CQ_N; c++)
00643             content_queue_destroy(h, &(face->q[c]));
00644         ccnd_msg(h, "%s face id %u (slot %u)",
00645             recycle ? "recycling" : "releasing",
00646             face->faceid, face->faceid & MAXFACES);
00647         /* Don't free face->addr; storage is managed by hash table */
00648     }
00649     else if (face->faceid != CCN_NOFACEID)
00650         ccnd_msg(h, "orphaned face %u", face->faceid);
00651     for (m = 0; m < CCND_FACE_METER_N; m++)
00652         ccnd_meter_destroy(&face->meter[m]);
00653 }
00654 
00655 /**
00656  * Convert an accession to its associated content handle.
00657  *
00658  * @returns content handle, or NULL if it is no longer available.
00659  */
00660 static struct content_entry *
00661 content_from_accession(struct ccnd_handle *h, ccn_accession_t accession)
00662 {
00663     struct content_entry *ans = NULL;
00664     if (accession < h->accession_base) {
00665         struct sparse_straggler_entry *entry;
00666         entry = hashtb_lookup(h->sparse_straggler_tab,
00667                               &accession, sizeof(accession));
00668         if (entry != NULL)
00669             ans = entry->content;
00670     }
00671     else if (accession < h->accession_base + h->content_by_accession_window) {
00672         ans = h->content_by_accession[accession - h->accession_base];
00673         if (ans != NULL && ans->accession != accession)
00674             ans = NULL;
00675     }
00676     return(ans);
00677 }
00678 
00679 /**
00680  *  Sweep old entries out of the direct accession-to-content table
00681  */
00682 static void
00683 cleanout_stragglers(struct ccnd_handle *h)
00684 {
00685     ccn_accession_t accession;
00686     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00687     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00688     struct sparse_straggler_entry *entry = NULL;
00689     struct content_entry **a = h->content_by_accession;
00690     unsigned n_direct;
00691     unsigned n_occupied;
00692     unsigned window;
00693     unsigned i;
00694     if (h->accession <= h->accession_base || a[0] == NULL)
00695         return;
00696     n_direct = h->accession - h->accession_base;
00697     if (n_direct < 1000)
00698         return;
00699     n_occupied = hashtb_n(h->content_tab) - hashtb_n(h->sparse_straggler_tab);
00700     if (n_occupied >= (n_direct / 8))
00701         return;
00702     /* The direct lookup table is too sparse, so sweep stragglers */
00703     hashtb_start(h->sparse_straggler_tab, e);
00704     window = h->content_by_accession_window;
00705     for (i = 0; i < window; i++) {
00706         if (a[i] != NULL) {
00707             if (n_occupied >= ((window - i) / 8))
00708                 break;
00709             accession = h->accession_base + i;
00710             hashtb_seek(e, &accession, sizeof(accession), 0);
00711             entry = e->data;
00712             if (entry != NULL && entry->content == NULL) {
00713                 entry->content = a[i];
00714                 a[i] = NULL;
00715                 n_occupied -= 1;
00716             }
00717         }
00718     }
00719     hashtb_end(e);
00720 }
00721 
00722 /**
00723  *  Prevent the direct accession-to-content table from becoming too sparse
00724  */
00725 static int
00726 cleanout_empties(struct ccnd_handle *h)
00727 {
00728     unsigned i = 0;
00729     unsigned j = 0;
00730     struct content_entry **a = h->content_by_accession;
00731     unsigned window = h->content_by_accession_window;
00732     if (a == NULL)
00733         return(-1);
00734     cleanout_stragglers(h);
00735     while (i < window && a[i] == NULL)
00736         i++;
00737     if (i == 0)
00738         return(-1);
00739     h->accession_base += i;
00740     while (i < window)
00741         a[j++] = a[i++];
00742     while (j < window)
00743         a[j++] = NULL;
00744     return(0);
00745 }
00746 
00747 /**
00748  * Assign an accession number to a content object
00749  */
00750 static void
00751 enroll_content(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00752 {
00753     unsigned new_window;
00754     struct content_entry **new_array;
00755     struct content_entry **old_array;
00756     unsigned i = 0;
00757     unsigned j = 0;
00758     unsigned window = h->content_by_accession_window;
00759     if ((content->accession - h->accession_base) >= window &&
00760           cleanout_empties(h) < 0) {
00761         if (content->accession < h->accession_base)
00762             return;
00763         window = h->content_by_accession_window;
00764         old_array = h->content_by_accession;
00765         new_window = ((window + 20) * 3 / 2);
00766         if (new_window < window)
00767             return;
00768         new_array = calloc(new_window, sizeof(new_array[0]));
00769         if (new_array == NULL)
00770             return;
00771         while (i < h->content_by_accession_window && old_array[i] == NULL)
00772             i++;
00773         h->accession_base += i;
00774         h->content_by_accession = new_array;
00775         while (i < h->content_by_accession_window)
00776             new_array[j++] = old_array[i++];
00777         h->content_by_accession_window = new_window;
00778     free(old_array);
00779     }
00780     h->content_by_accession[content->accession - h->accession_base] = content;
00781 }
00782 
00783 // the hash table this is for is going away
00784 static void
00785 finalize_content(struct hashtb_enumerator *content_enumerator)
00786 {
00787     struct ccnd_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(content_enumerator->ht, NULL);
00788     struct content_entry *entry = content_enumerator->data;
00789     unsigned i = entry->accession - h->accession_base;
00790     if (i < h->content_by_accession_window &&
00791           h->content_by_accession[i] == entry) {
00792         content_skiplist_remove(h, entry);
00793         h->content_by_accession[i] = NULL;
00794     }
00795     else {
00796         struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00797         struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00798         hashtb_start(h->sparse_straggler_tab, e);
00799         if (hashtb_seek(e, &entry->accession, sizeof(entry->accession), 0) ==
00800               HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
00801             ccnd_msg(h, "orphaned content %llu",
00802                      (unsigned long long)(entry->accession));
00803             hashtb_delete(e);
00804             hashtb_end(e);
00805             return;
00806         }
00807         content_skiplist_remove(h, entry);
00808         hashtb_delete(e);
00809         hashtb_end(e);
00810     }
00811     if (entry->comps != NULL) {
00812         free(entry->comps);
00813         entry->comps = NULL;
00814     }
00815 }
00816 
00817 /**
00818  * Find the skiplist entries associated with the key.
00819  *
00820  * @returns the number of entries of ans that were filled in.
00821  */
00822 static int
00823 content_skiplist_findbefore(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00824                             const unsigned char *key,
00825                             size_t keysize,
00826                             struct content_entry *wanted_old,
00827                             struct ccn_indexbuf **ans)
00828 {
00829     int i;
00830     int n = h->skiplinks->n;
00831     struct ccn_indexbuf *c;
00832     struct content_entry *content;
00833     int order;
00834     size_t start;
00835     size_t end;
00836     
00837     c = h->skiplinks;
00838     for (i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00839         for (;;) {
00840             if (c->buf[i] == 0)
00841                 break;
00842             content = content_from_accession(h, c->buf[i]);
00843             if (content == NULL)
00844                 abort();
00845             start = content->comps[0];
00846             end = content->comps[content->ncomps - 1];
00847             order = ccn_compare_names(content->key + start - 1, end - start + 2,
00848                                       key, keysize);
00849             if (order > 0)
00850                 break;
00851             if (order == 0 && (wanted_old == content || wanted_old == NULL))
00852                 break;
00853             if (content->skiplinks == NULL || i >= content->skiplinks->n)
00854                 abort();
00855             c = content->skiplinks;
00856         }
00857         ans[i] = c;
00858     }
00859     return(n);
00860 }
00861 
00862 /**
00863  * Limit for how deep our skiplists can be
00864  */
00865 #define CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH 30
00866 
00867 /**
00868  * Insert a new entry into the skiplist.
00869  */
00870 static void
00871 content_skiplist_insert(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00872 {
00873     int d;
00874     int i;
00875     size_t start;
00876     size_t end;
00877     struct ccn_indexbuf *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00878     if (content->skiplinks != NULL) abort();
00879     for (d = 1; d < CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH - 1; d++)
00880         if ((nrand48(h->seed) & 3) != 0) break;
00881     while (h->skiplinks->n < d)
00882         ccn_indexbuf_append_element(h->skiplinks, 0);
00883     start = content->comps[0];
00884     end = content->comps[content->ncomps - 1];
00885     i = content_skiplist_findbefore(h,
00886                                     content->key + start - 1,
00887                                     end - start + 2, NULL, pred);
00888     if (i < d)
00889         d = i; /* just in case */
00890     content->skiplinks = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00891     for (i = 0; i < d; i++) {
00892         ccn_indexbuf_append_element(content->skiplinks, pred[i]->buf[i]);
00893         pred[i]->buf[i] = content->accession;
00894     }
00895 }
00896 
00897 /**
00898  * Remove an entry from the skiplist.
00899  */
00900 static void
00901 content_skiplist_remove(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00902 {
00903     int i;
00904     int d;
00905     size_t start;
00906     size_t end;
00907     struct ccn_indexbuf *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00908     if (content->skiplinks == NULL) abort();
00909     start = content->comps[0];
00910     end = content->comps[content->ncomps - 1];
00911     d = content_skiplist_findbefore(h,
00912                                     content->key + start - 1,
00913                                     end - start + 2, content, pred);
00914     if (d > content->skiplinks->n)
00915         d = content->skiplinks->n;
00916     for (i = 0; i < d; i++) {
00917         pred[i]->buf[i] = content->skiplinks->buf[i];
00918     }
00919     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&content->skiplinks);
00920 }
00921 
00922 /**
00923  * Find the first candidate that might match the given interest.
00924  */
00925 static struct content_entry *
00926 find_first_match_candidate(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00927                            const unsigned char *interest_msg,
00928                            const struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi)
00929 {
00930     int res;
00931     struct ccn_indexbuf *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00932     size_t start = pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Name];
00933     size_t end = pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Name];
00934     struct ccn_charbuf *namebuf = NULL;
00935     if (pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] < pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Exclude]) {
00936         /* Check for <Exclude><Any/><Component>... fast case */
00937         struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
00938         struct ccn_buf_decoder *d;
00939         size_t ex1start;
00940         size_t ex1end;
00941         d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder,
00942                                   interest_msg + pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude],
00943                                   pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Exclude] -
00944                                   pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude]);
00945         ccn_buf_advance(d);
00946         if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Any)) {
00947             ccn_buf_advance(d);
00948             ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00949             if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Component)) {
00950                 ex1start = pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] + d->decoder.token_index;
00951                 ccn_buf_advance_past_element(d);
00952                 ex1end = pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] + d->decoder.token_index;
00953                 if (d->decoder.state >= 0) {
00954                     namebuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
00955                     ccn_charbuf_append(namebuf,
00956                                        interest_msg + start,
00957                                        end - start);
00958                     namebuf->length--;
00959                     ccn_charbuf_append(namebuf,
00960                                        interest_msg + ex1start,
00961                                        ex1end - ex1start);
00962                     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(namebuf);
00963                     if (h->debug & 8)
00964                         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "fastex", NULL,
00965                                         namebuf->buf, namebuf->length);
00966                 }
00967             }
00968         }
00969     }
00970     if (namebuf == NULL) {
00971         res = content_skiplist_findbefore(h, interest_msg + start, end - start,
00972                                           NULL, pred);
00973     }
00974     else {
00975         res = content_skiplist_findbefore(h, namebuf->buf, namebuf->length,
00976                                           NULL, pred);
00977         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&namebuf);
00978     }
00979     if (res == 0)
00980         return(NULL);
00981     return(content_from_accession(h, pred[0]->buf[0]));
00982 }
00983 
00984 /**
00985  * Check for a prefix match.
00986  */
00987 static int
00988 content_matches_interest_prefix(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00989                                 struct content_entry *content,
00990                                 const unsigned char *interest_msg,
00991                                 struct ccn_indexbuf *comps,
00992                                 int prefix_comps)
00993 {
00994     size_t prefixlen;
00995     if (prefix_comps < 0 || prefix_comps >= comps->n)
00996         abort();
00997     /* First verify the prefix match. */
00998     if (content->ncomps < prefix_comps + 1)
00999             return(0);
01000     prefixlen = comps->buf[prefix_comps] - comps->buf[0];
01001     if (content->comps[prefix_comps] - content->comps[0] != prefixlen)
01002         return(0);
01003     if (0 != memcmp(content->key + content->comps[0],
01004                     interest_msg + comps->buf[0],
01005                     prefixlen))
01006         return(0);
01007     return(1);
01008 }
01009 
01010 /**
01011  * Advance to the next entry in the skiplist.
01012  */
01013 static ccn_accession_t
01014 content_skiplist_next(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
01015 {
01016     if (content == NULL)
01017         return(0);
01018     if (content->skiplinks == NULL || content->skiplinks->n < 1)
01019         return(0);
01020     return(content->skiplinks->buf[0]);
01021 }
01022 
01023 /**
01024  * Consume an interest.
01025  */
01026 static void
01027 consume_interest(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct interest_entry *ie)
01028 {
01029     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01030     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01031     int res;
01032     
01033     hashtb_start(h->interest_tab, e);
01034     res = hashtb_seek(e, ie->interest_msg, ie->size - 1, 1);
01035     if (res != HT_OLD_ENTRY)
01036         abort();
01037     hashtb_delete(e);
01038     hashtb_end(e);
01039 }    
01040 
01041 /**
01042  * Clean up a name prefix entry when it is removed from the hash table.
01043  */
01044 static void
01045 finalize_nameprefix(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
01046 {
01047     struct ccnd_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(e->ht, NULL);
01048     struct nameprefix_entry *npe = e->data;
01049     struct ielinks *head = &npe->ie_head;
01050     if (head->next != NULL) {
01051         while (head->next != head)
01052             consume_interest(h, (struct interest_entry *)(head->next));
01053     }
01054     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&npe->forward_to);
01055     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&npe->tap);
01056     while (npe->forwarding != NULL) {
01057         struct ccn_forwarding *f = npe->forwarding;
01058         npe->forwarding = f->next;
01059         free(f);
01060     }
01061 }
01062 
01063 /**
01064  * Link an interest to its name prefix entry.
01065  */
01066 static void
01067 link_interest_entry_to_nameprefix(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01068     struct interest_entry *ie, struct nameprefix_entry *npe)
01069 {
01070     struct ielinks *head = &npe->ie_head;
01071     struct ielinks *ll = &ie->ll;
01072     ll->next = head;
01073     ll->prev = head->prev;
01074     ll->prev->next = ll->next->prev = ll;
01075     ll->npe = npe;
01076 }
01077 
01078 /**
01079  * Clean up an interest_entry when it is removed from its hash table.
01080  */
01081 static void
01082 finalize_interest(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
01083 {
01084     struct pit_face_item *p = NULL;
01085     struct pit_face_item *next = NULL;
01086     struct ccnd_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(e->ht, NULL);
01087     struct interest_entry *ie = e->data;
01088     struct face *face = NULL;
01089 
01090     if (ie->ev != NULL)
01091         ccn_schedule_cancel(h->sched, ie->ev);
01092     if (ie->strategy.ev != NULL)
01093         ccn_schedule_cancel(h->sched, ie->strategy.ev);
01094     if (ie->ll.next != NULL) {
01095         ie->ll.next->prev = ie->ll.prev;
01096         ie->ll.prev->next = ie->ll.next;
01097         ie->ll.next = ie->ll.prev = NULL;
01098         ie->ll.npe = NULL;
01099     }
01100     for (p = ie->pfl; p != NULL; p = next) {
01101         next = p->next;
01102         if ((p->pfi_flags & CCND_PFI_PENDING) != 0) {
01103             face = face_from_faceid(h, p->faceid);
01104             if (face != NULL)
01105                 face->pending_interests -= 1;
01106         }
01107         free(p);
01108     }
01109     ie->pfl = NULL;
01110     ie->interest_msg = NULL; /* part of hashtb, don't free this */
01111 }
01112 
01113 /**
01114  * Clean up a guest_entry when it is removed from its hash table.
01115  */
01116 static void
01117 finalize_guest(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
01118 {
01119     struct guest_entry *g = e->data;
01120     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&g->cob);
01121 }
01122 
01123 /**
01124  * Create a listener on a unix-domain socket.
01125  */
01126 static int
01127 create_local_listener(struct ccnd_handle *h, const char *sockname, int backlog)
01128 {
01129     int res;
01130     int savedmask;
01131     int sock;
01132     struct sockaddr_un a = { 0 };
01133     res = unlink(sockname);
01134     if (res == 0) {
01135         ccnd_msg(NULL, "unlinked old %s, please wait", sockname);
01136         sleep(9); /* give old ccnd a chance to exit */
01137     }
01138     if (!(res == 0 || errno == ENOENT))
01139         ccnd_msg(NULL, "failed to unlink %s", sockname);
01140     a.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
01141     strncpy(a.sun_path, sockname, sizeof(a.sun_path));
01142     sock = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
01143     if (sock == -1)
01144         return(sock);
01145     savedmask = umask(0111); /* socket should be R/W by anybody */
01146     res = bind(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&a, sizeof(a));
01147     umask(savedmask);
01148     if (res == -1) {
01149         close(sock);
01150         return(-1);
01151     }
01152     unlink_at_exit(sockname);
01153     res = listen(sock, backlog);
01154     if (res == -1) {
01155         close(sock);
01156         return(-1);
01157     }
01158     record_connection(h, sock, (struct sockaddr *)&a, sizeof(a),
01159                       (CCN_FACE_LOCAL | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE));
01160     return(sock);
01161 }
01162 
01163 /**
01164  * Adjust socket buffer limit
01165  */
01166 static int
01167 establish_min_recv_bufsize(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd, int minsize)
01168 {
01169     int res;
01170     int rcvbuf;
01171     socklen_t rcvbuf_sz;
01172 
01173     rcvbuf_sz = sizeof(rcvbuf);
01174     res = getsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, &rcvbuf, &rcvbuf_sz);
01175     if (res == -1)
01176         return (res);
01177     if (rcvbuf < minsize) {
01178         rcvbuf = minsize;
01179         res = setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, &rcvbuf, sizeof(rcvbuf));
01180         if (res == -1)
01181             return(res);
01182     }
01183     ccnd_msg(h, "SO_RCVBUF for fd %d is %d", fd, rcvbuf);
01184     return(rcvbuf);
01185 }
01186 
01187 /**
01188  * Initialize the face flags based upon the addr information
01189  * and the provided explicit setflags.
01190  */
01191 static void
01192 init_face_flags(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, int setflags)
01193 {
01194     const struct sockaddr *addr = face->addr;
01195     const unsigned char *rawaddr = NULL;
01196     
01197     if (addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
01198         const struct sockaddr_in6 *addr6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)addr;
01199         face->flags |= CCN_FACE_INET6;
01200 #ifdef IN6_IS_ADDR_LOOPBACK
01201         if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LOOPBACK(&addr6->sin6_addr))
01202             face->flags |= CCN_FACE_LOOPBACK;
01203 #endif
01204     }
01205     else if (addr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
01206         const struct sockaddr_in *addr4 = (struct sockaddr_in *)addr;
01207         rawaddr = (const unsigned char *)&addr4->sin_addr.s_addr;
01208         face->flags |= CCN_FACE_INET;
01209         if (rawaddr[0] == 127)
01210             face->flags |= CCN_FACE_LOOPBACK;
01211         else {
01212             /* If our side and the peer have the same address, consider it loopback */
01213             /* This is the situation inside of FreeBSD jail. */
01214             struct sockaddr_in myaddr;
01215             socklen_t myaddrlen = sizeof(myaddr);
01216             if (0 == getsockname(face->recv_fd, (struct sockaddr *)&myaddr, &myaddrlen)) {
01217                 if (addr4->sin_addr.s_addr == myaddr.sin_addr.s_addr)
01218                     face->flags |= CCN_FACE_LOOPBACK;
01219             }
01220         }
01221     }
01222     else if (addr->sa_family == AF_UNIX)
01223         face->flags |= (CCN_FACE_GG | CCN_FACE_LOCAL);
01224     face->flags |= setflags;
01225 }
01226 
01227 /**
01228  * Make a new face entered in the faces_by_fd table.
01229  */
01230 static struct face *
01231 record_connection(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd,
01232                   struct sockaddr *who, socklen_t wholen,
01233                   int setflags)
01234 {
01235     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01236     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01237     int res;
01238     struct face *face = NULL;
01239     unsigned char *addrspace;
01240     
01241     res = fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
01242     if (res == -1)
01243         ccnd_msg(h, "fcntl: %s", strerror(errno));
01244     hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e);
01245     if (hashtb_seek(e, &fd, sizeof(fd), wholen) == HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
01246         face = e->data;
01247         face->recv_fd = fd;
01248         face->sendface = CCN_NOFACEID;
01249         face->addrlen = e->extsize;
01250         addrspace = ((unsigned char *)e->key) + e->keysize;
01251         face->addr = (struct sockaddr *)addrspace;
01252         memcpy(addrspace, who, e->extsize);
01253         init_face_flags(h, face, setflags);
01254         res = enroll_face(h, face);
01255         if (res == -1) {
01256             hashtb_delete(e);
01257             face = NULL;
01258         }
01259     }
01260     hashtb_end(e);
01261     return(face);
01262 }
01263 
01264 /**
01265  * Accept an incoming SOCK_STREAM connection, creating a new face.
01266  *
01267  * This could be, for example, a unix-domain socket, or TCP.
01268  *
01269  * @returns fd of new socket, or -1 for an error.
01270  */
01271 static int
01272 accept_connection(struct ccnd_handle *h, int listener_fd)
01273 {
01274     struct sockaddr_storage who;
01275     socklen_t wholen = sizeof(who);
01276     int fd;
01277     struct face *face;
01278 
01279     fd = accept(listener_fd, (struct sockaddr *)&who, &wholen);
01280     if (fd == -1) {
01281         ccnd_msg(h, "accept: %s", strerror(errno));
01282         return(-1);
01283     }
01284     face = record_connection(h, fd,
01285                             (struct sockaddr *)&who, wholen,
01286                             CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED);
01287     if (face == NULL)
01288         close_fd(&fd);
01289     else
01290         ccnd_msg(h, "accepted client fd=%d id=%u", fd, face->faceid);
01291     return(fd);
01292 }
01293 
01294 /**
01295  * Make an outbound stream connection.
01296  */
01297 static struct face *
01298 make_connection(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01299                 struct sockaddr *who, socklen_t wholen,
01300                 int setflags)
01301 {
01302     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01303     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01304     int fd;
01305     int res;
01306     struct face *face;
01307     const int checkflags = CCN_FACE_LINK | CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_LOCAL |
01308                            CCN_FACE_NOSEND | CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED;
01309     const int wantflags = 0;
01310     
01311     /* Check for an existing usable connection */
01312     for (hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
01313         face = e->data;
01314         if (face->addr != NULL && face->addrlen == wholen &&
01315             ((face->flags & checkflags) == wantflags) &&
01316             0 == memcmp(face->addr, who, wholen)) {
01317             hashtb_end(e);
01318             return(face);
01319         }
01320     }
01321     face = NULL;
01322     hashtb_end(e);
01323     /* No existing connection, try to make a new one. */
01324     fd = socket(who->sa_family, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
01325     if (fd == -1) {
01326         ccnd_msg(h, "socket: %s", strerror(errno));
01327         return(NULL);
01328     }
01329     res = fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
01330     if (res == -1)
01331         ccnd_msg(h, "connect fcntl: %s", strerror(errno));
01332     setflags &= ~CCN_FACE_CONNECTING;
01333     res = connect(fd, who, wholen);
01334     if (res == -1 && errno == EINPROGRESS) {
01335         res = 0;
01336         setflags |= CCN_FACE_CONNECTING;
01337     }
01338     if (res == -1) {
01339         ccnd_msg(h, "connect failed: %s (errno = %d)", strerror(errno), errno);
01340         close(fd);
01341         return(NULL);
01342     }
01343     face = record_connection(h, fd, who, wholen, setflags);
01344     if (face == NULL) {
01345         close(fd);
01346         return(NULL);
01347     }
01348     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_CONNECTING) != 0) {
01349         ccnd_msg(h, "connecting to client fd=%d id=%u", fd, face->faceid);
01350         face->outbufindex = 0;
01351         face->outbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
01352     }
01353     else
01354         ccnd_msg(h, "connected client fd=%d id=%u", fd, face->faceid);
01355     return(face);
01356 }
01357 
01358 /**
01359  * Get a bound datagram socket.
01360  *
01361  * This is handed to ccn_setup_socket() when setting up a multicast face.
01362  */
01363 static int
01364 ccnd_getboundsocket(void *dat, struct sockaddr *who, socklen_t wholen)
01365 {
01366     struct ccnd_handle *h = dat;
01367     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01368     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01369     int yes = 1;
01370     int res;
01371     int ans = -1;
01372     int wantflags = (CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE);
01373     for (hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
01374         struct face *face = e->data;
01375         if ((face->flags & wantflags) == wantflags &&
01376               wholen == face->addrlen &&
01377               0 == memcmp(who, face->addr, wholen)) {
01378             ans = face->recv_fd;
01379             break;
01380         }
01381     }
01382     hashtb_end(e);
01383     if (ans != -1)
01384         return(ans);
01385     ans = socket(who->sa_family, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
01386     if (ans == -1)
01387         return(ans);
01388     setsockopt(ans, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof(yes));
01389     res = bind(ans, who, wholen);
01390     if (res == -1) {
01391         ccnd_msg(h, "bind failed: %s (errno = %d)", strerror(errno), errno);
01392         close(ans);
01393         return(-1);
01394     }
01395     record_connection(h, ans, who, wholen,
01396                       CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE | CCN_FACE_NORECV);
01397     return(ans);
01398 }
01399 
01400 /**
01401  * Get the faceid associated with a file descriptor.
01402  *
01403  * @returns the faceid, or CCN_NOFACEID.
01404  */
01405 static unsigned
01406 faceid_from_fd(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd)
01407 {
01408     struct face *face = hashtb_lookup(h->faces_by_fd, &fd, sizeof(fd));
01409     if (face != NULL)
01410         return(face->faceid);
01411     return(CCN_NOFACEID);
01412 }
01413 
01414 typedef void (*loggerproc)(void *, const char *, ...);
01415 
01416 /**
01417  * Set up a multicast face.
01418  */
01419 static struct face *
01420 setup_multicast(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct ccn_face_instance *face_instance,
01421                 struct sockaddr *who, socklen_t wholen)
01422 {
01423     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01424     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01425     struct ccn_sockets socks = { -1, -1 };
01426     int res;
01427     struct face *face = NULL;
01428     const int checkflags = CCN_FACE_LINK | CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_MCAST |
01429                            CCN_FACE_LOCAL | CCN_FACE_NOSEND;
01430     const int wantflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_MCAST;
01431 
01432     /* See if one is already active */
01433     // XXX - should also compare and record additional mcast props.
01434     for (hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
01435         face = e->data;
01436         if (face->addr != NULL && face->addrlen == wholen &&
01437             ((face->flags & checkflags) == wantflags) &&
01438             0 == memcmp(face->addr, who, wholen)) {
01439             hashtb_end(e);
01440             return(face);
01441         }
01442     }
01443     face = NULL;
01444     hashtb_end(e);
01445     
01446     res = ccn_setup_socket(&face_instance->descr,
01447                            (loggerproc)&ccnd_msg, (void *)h,
01448                            &ccnd_getboundsocket, (void *)h,
01449                            &socks);
01450     if (res < 0)
01451         return(NULL);
01452     establish_min_recv_bufsize(h, socks.recving, 128*1024);
01453     face = record_connection(h, socks.recving, who, wholen,
01454                              (CCN_FACE_MCAST | CCN_FACE_DGRAM));
01455     if (face == NULL) {
01456         close(socks.recving);
01457         if (socks.sending != socks.recving)
01458             close(socks.sending); // XXX - could be problematic, but record_connection is unlikely to fail for other than ENOMEM
01459         return(NULL);
01460     }
01461     face->sendface = faceid_from_fd(h, socks.sending);
01462     ccnd_msg(h, "multicast on fd=%d id=%u, sending on face %u",
01463              face->recv_fd, face->faceid, face->sendface);
01464     return(face);
01465 }
01466 
01467 /**
01468  * Close a socket, destroying the associated face.
01469  */
01470 static void
01471 shutdown_client_fd(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd)
01472 {
01473     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01474     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01475     struct face *face = NULL;
01476     unsigned faceid = CCN_NOFACEID;
01477     hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e);
01478     if (hashtb_seek(e, &fd, sizeof(fd), 0) == HT_OLD_ENTRY) {
01479         face = e->data;
01480         if (face->recv_fd != fd) abort();
01481         faceid = face->faceid;
01482         if (faceid == CCN_NOFACEID) {
01483             ccnd_msg(h, "error indication on fd %d ignored", fd);
01484             hashtb_end(e);
01485             return;
01486         }
01487         close(fd);
01488         face->recv_fd = -1;
01489         ccnd_msg(h, "shutdown client fd=%d id=%u", fd, faceid);
01490         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->inbuf);
01491         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->outbuf);
01492         face = NULL;
01493     }
01494     hashtb_delete(e);
01495     hashtb_end(e);
01496     check_comm_file(h);
01497 }
01498 
01499 /**
01500  * Send a ContentObject
01501  *
01502  * This is after it has worked its way through the queue; update the meters
01503  * and stuff the packet as appropriate.
01504  */
01505 static void
01506 send_content(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, struct content_entry *content)
01507 {
01508     int n, a, b, size;
01509     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_NOSEND) != 0) {
01510         // XXX - should count this.
01511         return;
01512     }
01513     size = content->size;
01514     if (h->debug & 4)
01515         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "content_to", face,
01516                         content->key, size);
01517     /* Excise the message-digest name component */
01518     n = content->ncomps;
01519     if (n < 2) abort();
01520     a = content->comps[n - 2];
01521     b = content->comps[n - 1];
01522     if (b - a != 36)
01523         abort(); /* strange digest length */
01524     stuff_and_send(h, face, content->key, a, content->key + b, size - b, 0, 0);
01525     ccnd_meter_bump(h, face->meter[FM_DATO], 1);
01526     h->content_items_sent += 1;
01527 }
01528 
01529 /**
01530  * Select the output queue class for a piece of content
01531  */
01532 static enum cq_delay_class
01533 choose_content_delay_class(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid, int content_flags)
01534 {
01535     struct face *face = face_from_faceid(h, faceid);
01536     if (face == NULL)
01537         return(CCN_CQ_ASAP); /* Going nowhere, get it over with */
01538     if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_LINK | CCN_FACE_MCAST)) != 0) /* udplink or such, delay more */
01539         return((content_flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_SLOWSEND) ? CCN_CQ_SLOW : CCN_CQ_NORMAL);
01540     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) != 0)
01541         return(CCN_CQ_NORMAL); /* udp, delay just a little */
01542     if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_GG | CCN_FACE_LOCAL)) != 0)
01543         return(CCN_CQ_ASAP); /* localhost, answer quickly */
01544     return(CCN_CQ_NORMAL); /* default */
01545 }
01546 
01547 /**
01548  * Pick a randomized delay for sending
01549  *
01550  * This is primarily for multicast and similar broadcast situations, where we
01551  * may see the content being sent by somebody else.  If that is the case,
01552  * we will avoid sending our copy as well.
01553  *
01554  */
01555 static unsigned
01556 randomize_content_delay(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_queue *q)
01557 {
01558     unsigned usec;
01559     
01560     usec = q->min_usec + q->rand_usec;
01561     if (usec < 2)
01562         return(1);
01563     if (usec <= 20 || q->rand_usec < 2) // XXX - what is a good value for this?
01564         return(usec); /* small value, don't bother to randomize */
01565     usec = q->min_usec + (nrand48(h->seed) % q->rand_usec);
01566     if (usec < 2)
01567         return(1);
01568     return(usec);
01569 }
01570 
01571 /**
01572  * Scheduled event for sending from a queue.
01573  */
01574 static int
01575 content_sender(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
01576     void *clienth,
01577     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
01578     int flags)
01579 {
01580     int i, j;
01581     int delay;
01582     int nsec;
01583     int burst_nsec;
01584     int burst_max;
01585     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
01586     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
01587     unsigned faceid = ev->evint;
01588     struct face *face = NULL;
01589     struct content_queue *q = ev->evdata;
01590     (void)sched;
01591     
01592     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0)
01593         goto Bail;
01594     face = face_from_faceid(h, faceid);
01595     if (face == NULL)
01596         goto Bail;
01597     if (q->send_queue == NULL)
01598         goto Bail;
01599     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_NOSEND) != 0)
01600         goto Bail;
01601     /* Send the content at the head of the queue */
01602     if (q->ready > q->send_queue->n ||
01603         (q->ready == 0 && q->nrun >= 12 && q->nrun < 120))
01604         q->ready = q->send_queue->n;
01605     nsec = 0;
01606     burst_nsec = q->burst_nsec;
01607     burst_max = 2;
01608     if (q->ready < burst_max)
01609         burst_max = q->ready;
01610     if (burst_max == 0)
01611         q->nrun = 0;
01612     for (i = 0; i < burst_max && nsec < 1000000; i++) {
01613         content = content_from_accession(h, q->send_queue->buf[i]);
01614         if (content == NULL)
01615             q->nrun = 0;
01616         else {
01617             send_content(h, face, content);
01618             /* face may have vanished, bail out if it did */
01619             if (face_from_faceid(h, faceid) == NULL)
01620                 goto Bail;
01621             nsec += burst_nsec * (unsigned)((content->size + 1023) / 1024);
01622             q->nrun++;
01623         }
01624     }
01625     if (q->ready < i) abort();
01626     q->ready -= i;
01627     /* Update queue */
01628     for (j = 0; i < q->send_queue->n; i++, j++)
01629         q->send_queue->buf[j] = q->send_queue->buf[i];
01630     q->send_queue->n = j;
01631     /* Do a poll before going on to allow others to preempt send. */
01632     delay = (nsec + 499) / 1000 + 1;
01633     if (q->ready > 0) {
01634         if (h->debug & 8)
01635             ccnd_msg(h, "face %u ready %u delay %i nrun %u",
01636                      faceid, q->ready, delay, q->nrun, face->surplus);
01637         return(delay);
01638     }
01639     q->ready = j;
01640     if (q->nrun >= 12 && q->nrun < 120) {
01641         /* We seem to be a preferred provider, forgo the randomized delay */
01642         if (j == 0)
01643             delay += burst_nsec / 50;
01644         if (h->debug & 8)
01645             ccnd_msg(h, "face %u ready %u delay %i nrun %u surplus %u",
01646                     (unsigned)ev->evint, q->ready, delay, q->nrun, face->surplus);
01647         return(delay);
01648     }
01649     /* Determine when to run again */
01650     for (i = 0; i < q->send_queue->n; i++) {
01651         content = content_from_accession(h, q->send_queue->buf[i]);
01652         if (content != NULL) {
01653             q->nrun = 0;
01654             delay = randomize_content_delay(h, q);
01655             if (h->debug & 8)
01656                 ccnd_msg(h, "face %u queued %u delay %i",
01657                          (unsigned)ev->evint, q->ready, delay);
01658             return(delay);
01659         }
01660     }
01661     q->send_queue->n = q->ready = 0;
01662 Bail:
01663     q->sender = NULL;
01664     return(0);
01665 }
01666 
01667 /**
01668  * Queue a ContentObject to be sent on a face.
01669  */
01670 static int
01671 face_send_queue_insert(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01672                        struct face *face, struct content_entry *content)
01673 {
01674     int ans;
01675     int delay;
01676     enum cq_delay_class c;
01677     enum cq_delay_class k;
01678     struct content_queue *q;
01679     if (face == NULL || content == NULL || (face->flags & CCN_FACE_NOSEND) != 0)
01680         return(-1);
01681     c = choose_content_delay_class(h, face->faceid, content->flags);
01682     if (face->q[c] == NULL)
01683         face->q[c] = content_queue_create(h, face, c);
01684     q = face->q[c];
01685     if (q == NULL)
01686         return(-1);
01687     /* Check the other queues first, it might be in one of them */
01688     for (k = 0; k < CCN_CQ_N; k++) {
01689         if (k != c && face->q[k] != NULL) {
01690             ans = ccn_indexbuf_member(face->q[k]->send_queue, content->accession);
01691             if (ans >= 0) {
01692                 if (h->debug & 8)
01693                     ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "content_otherq", face,
01694                                     content->key, content->size);
01695                 return(ans);
01696             }
01697         }
01698     }
01699     ans = ccn_indexbuf_set_insert(q->send_queue, content->accession);
01700     if (q->sender == NULL) {
01701         delay = randomize_content_delay(h, q);
01702         q->ready = q->send_queue->n;
01703         q->sender = ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, delay,
01704                                        content_sender, q, face->faceid);
01705         if (h->debug & 8)
01706             ccnd_msg(h, "face %u q %d delay %d usec", face->faceid, c, delay);
01707     }
01708     return (ans);
01709 }
01710 
01711 /**
01712  * Return true iff the interest is pending on the given face
01713  */
01714 static int
01715 is_pending_on(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct interest_entry *ie, unsigned faceid)
01716 {
01717     struct pit_face_item *x;
01718     
01719     for (x = ie->pfl; x != NULL; x = x->next) {
01720         if (x->faceid == faceid && (x->pfi_flags & CCND_PFI_PENDING) != 0)
01721             return(1);
01722         // XXX - depending on how list is ordered, an early out might be possible
01723         // For now, we assume no particular ordering
01724     }
01725     return(0);
01726 }
01727 
01728 /**
01729  * Consume matching interests
01730  * given a nameprefix_entry and a piece of content.
01731  *
01732  * If face is not NULL, pay attention only to interests from that face.
01733  * It is allowed to pass NULL for pc, but if you have a (valid) one it
01734  * will avoid a re-parse.
01735  * @returns number of matches found.
01736  */
01737 static int
01738 consume_matching_interests(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01739                            struct nameprefix_entry *npe,
01740                            struct content_entry *content,
01741                            struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pc,
01742                            struct face *face)
01743 {
01744     int matches = 0;
01745     struct ielinks *head;
01746     struct ielinks *next;
01747     struct ielinks *pl;
01748     struct interest_entry *p;
01749     struct pit_face_item *x;
01750     const unsigned char *content_msg;
01751     size_t content_size;
01752     
01753     head = &npe->ie_head;
01754     content_msg = content->key;
01755     content_size = content->size;
01756     for (pl = head->next; pl != head; pl = next) {
01757         next = pl->next;
01758         p = (struct interest_entry *)pl;
01759         if (p->interest_msg == NULL)
01760             continue;
01761         if (face != NULL && is_pending_on(h, p, face->faceid) == 0)
01762             continue;
01763         if (ccn_content_matches_interest(content_msg, content_size, 0, pc,
01764                                          p->interest_msg, p->size, NULL)) {
01765             for (x = p->pfl; x != NULL; x = x->next) {
01766                 if ((x->pfi_flags & CCND_PFI_PENDING) != 0)
01767                     face_send_queue_insert(h, face_from_faceid(h, x->faceid),
01768                                            content);
01769             }
01770             matches += 1;
01771             strategy_callout(h, p, CCNST_SATISFIED);
01772             consume_interest(h, p);
01773         }
01774     }
01775     return(matches);
01776 }
01777 
01778 /**
01779  * Adjust the predicted response associated with a name prefix entry.
01780  *
01781  * It is decreased by a small fraction if we get content within our
01782  * previous predicted value, and increased by a larger fraction if not.
01783  *
01784  */
01785 static void
01786 adjust_npe_predicted_response(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01787                               struct nameprefix_entry *npe, int up)
01788 {
01789     unsigned t = npe->usec;
01790     if (up)
01791         t = t + (t >> 3);
01792     else
01793         t = t - (t >> 7);
01794     if (t < 127)
01795         t = 127;
01796     else if (t > 160000)
01797         t = 160000;
01798     npe->usec = t;
01799 }
01800 
01801 /**
01802  * Adjust the predicted responses for an interest.
01803  *
01804  * We adjust two npes, so that the parents are informed about activity
01805  * at the leaves.
01806  *
01807  */
01808 static void
01809 adjust_predicted_response(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01810                           struct interest_entry *ie, int up)
01811 {
01812     struct nameprefix_entry *npe;
01813         
01814     npe = ie->ll.npe;
01815     if (npe == NULL)
01816         return;
01817     adjust_npe_predicted_response(h, npe, up);
01818     if (npe->parent != NULL)
01819         adjust_npe_predicted_response(h, npe->parent, up);
01820 }
01821 
01822 /**
01823  * Keep a little history about where matching content comes from.
01824  */
01825 static void
01826 note_content_from(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01827                   struct nameprefix_entry *npe,
01828                   unsigned from_faceid,
01829                   int prefix_comps)
01830 {
01831     if (npe->src == from_faceid)
01832         adjust_npe_predicted_response(h, npe, 0);
01833     else if (npe->src == CCN_NOFACEID)
01834         npe->src = from_faceid;
01835     else {
01836         npe->osrc = npe->src;
01837         npe->src = from_faceid;
01838     }
01839     if (h->debug & 8)
01840         ccnd_msg(h, "sl.%d %u ci=%d osrc=%u src=%u usec=%d", __LINE__,
01841                  from_faceid, prefix_comps, npe->osrc, npe->src, npe->usec);
01842 }
01843 
01844 /**
01845  * Find and consume interests that match given content.
01846  *
01847  * Schedules the sending of the content.
01848  * If face is not NULL, pay attention only to interests from that face.
01849  * It is allowed to pass NULL for pc, but if you have a (valid) one it
01850  * will avoid a re-parse.
01851  * For new content, from_face is the source; for old content, from_face is NULL.
01852  * @returns number of matches, or -1 if the new content should be dropped.
01853  */
01854 static int
01855 match_interests(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content,
01856                            struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pc,
01857                            struct face *face, struct face *from_face)
01858 {
01859     int n_matched = 0;
01860     int new_matches;
01861     int ci;
01862     int cm = 0;
01863     unsigned c0 = content->comps[0];
01864     const unsigned char *key = content->key + c0;
01865     struct nameprefix_entry *npe = NULL;
01866     for (ci = content->ncomps - 1; ci >= 0; ci--) {
01867         int size = content->comps[ci] - c0;
01868         npe = hashtb_lookup(h->nameprefix_tab, key, size);
01869         if (npe != NULL)
01870             break;
01871     }
01872     for (; npe != NULL; npe = npe->parent, ci--) {
01873         if (npe->fgen != h->forward_to_gen)
01874             update_forward_to(h, npe);
01875         if (from_face != NULL && (npe->flags & CCN_FORW_LOCAL) != 0 &&
01876             (from_face->flags & CCN_FACE_GG) == 0)
01877             return(-1);
01878         new_matches = consume_matching_interests(h, npe, content, pc, face);
01879         if (from_face != NULL && (new_matches != 0 || ci + 1 == cm))
01880             note_content_from(h, npe, from_face->faceid, ci);
01881         if (new_matches != 0) {
01882             cm = ci; /* update stats for this prefix and one shorter */
01883             n_matched += new_matches;
01884         }
01885     }
01886     return(n_matched);
01887 }
01888 
01889 /**
01890  * Send a message in a PDU, possibly stuffing other interest messages into it.
01891  * The message may be in two pieces.
01892  */
01893 static void
01894 stuff_and_send(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face,
01895                const unsigned char *data1, size_t size1,
01896                const unsigned char *data2, size_t size2,
01897                const char *tag, int lineno) {
01898     struct ccn_charbuf *c = NULL;
01899     
01900     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_LINK) != 0) {
01901         c = charbuf_obtain(h);
01902         ccn_charbuf_reserve(c, size1 + size2 + 5 + 8);
01903         ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, CCN_DTAG_CCNProtocolDataUnit, CCN_DTAG);
01904         ccn_charbuf_append(c, data1, size1);
01905         if (size2 != 0)
01906             ccn_charbuf_append(c, data2, size2);
01907         if (tag != NULL)
01908             ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, lineno, tag, face, c->buf + 4, c->length - 4);
01909         ccn_stuff_interest(h, face, c);
01910         ccn_append_link_stuff(h, face, c);
01911         ccn_charbuf_append_closer(c);
01912     }
01913     else if (size2 != 0 || h->mtu > size1 + size2 ||
01914              (face->flags & (CCN_FACE_SEQOK | CCN_FACE_SEQPROBE)) != 0 ||
01915              face->recvcount == 0) {
01916         c = charbuf_obtain(h);
01917         ccn_charbuf_append(c, data1, size1);
01918         if (size2 != 0)
01919             ccn_charbuf_append(c, data2, size2);
01920         if (tag != NULL)
01921             ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, lineno, tag, face, c->buf, c->length);
01922         ccn_stuff_interest(h, face, c);
01923         ccn_append_link_stuff(h, face, c);
01924     }
01925     else {
01926         /* avoid a copy in this case */
01927         if (tag != NULL)
01928             ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, lineno, tag, face, data1, size1);
01929         ccnd_send(h, face, data1, size1);
01930         return;
01931     }
01932     ccnd_send(h, face, c->buf, c->length);
01933     charbuf_release(h, c);
01934     return;
01935 }
01936 
01937 /**
01938  * Append a link-check interest if appropriate.
01939  *
01940  * @returns the number of messages that were stuffed.
01941  */
01942 static int
01943 stuff_link_check(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01944                    struct face *face, struct ccn_charbuf *c)
01945 {
01946     int checkflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_MCAST | CCN_FACE_GG | CCN_FACE_LC;
01947     int wantflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM;
01948     struct ccn_charbuf *name = NULL;
01949     struct ccn_charbuf *ibuf = NULL;
01950     int res;
01951     int ans = 0;
01952     if (face->recvcount > 0)
01953         return(0);
01954     if ((face->flags & checkflags) != wantflags)
01955         return(0);
01956     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
01957     if (name == NULL) goto Bail;
01958     ccn_name_init(name);
01959     res = ccn_name_from_uri(name, CCNDID_NEIGHBOR_URI);
01960     if (res < 0) goto Bail;
01961     ibuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
01962     if (ibuf == NULL) goto Bail;
01963     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(ibuf, CCN_DTAG_Interest, CCN_DTAG);
01964     ccn_charbuf_append(ibuf, name->buf, name->length);
01965     ccnb_tagged_putf(ibuf, CCN_DTAG_Scope, "2");
01966     // XXX - ought to generate a nonce
01967     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(ibuf);
01968     ccn_charbuf_append(c, ibuf->buf, ibuf->length);
01969     ccnd_meter_bump(h, face->meter[FM_INTO], 1);
01970     h->interests_stuffed++;
01971     face->flags |= CCN_FACE_LC;
01972     if (h->debug & 2)
01973         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "stuff_interest_to", face,
01974                         ibuf->buf, ibuf->length);
01975     ans = 1;
01976 Bail:
01977     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&ibuf);
01978     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
01979     return(ans);
01980 }
01981 
01982 /**
01983  * Stuff a PDU with interest messages that will fit.
01984  *
01985  * @returns the number of messages that were stuffed.
01986  */
01987 static int
01988 ccn_stuff_interest(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01989                    struct face *face, struct ccn_charbuf *c)
01990 {
01991     int n_stuffed = 0;
01992     
01993     n_stuffed += stuff_link_check(h, face, c);
01994     return(n_stuffed);
01995 }
01996 
01997 /**
01998  * Set up to send one sequence number to see it the other side wants to play.
01999  *
02000  * If we don't hear a number from the other side, we won't keep sending them.
02001  */
02002 static void
02003 ccn_link_state_init(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face)
02004 {
02005     int checkflags;
02006     int matchflags;
02007     
02008     matchflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM;
02009     checkflags = matchflags | CCN_FACE_MCAST | CCN_FACE_GG | CCN_FACE_SEQOK | \
02010                  CCN_FACE_PASSIVE;
02011     if ((face->flags & checkflags) != matchflags)
02012         return;
02013     /* Send one sequence number to see if the other side wants to play. */
02014     face->pktseq = nrand48(h->seed);
02015     face->flags |= CCN_FACE_SEQPROBE;
02016 }
02017 
02018 /**
02019  * Append a sequence number if appropriate.
02020  */
02021 static void
02022 ccn_append_link_stuff(struct ccnd_handle *h,
02023                       struct face *face,
02024                       struct ccn_charbuf *c)
02025 {
02026     if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_SEQOK | CCN_FACE_SEQPROBE)) == 0)
02027         return;
02028     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, CCN_DTAG_SequenceNumber, CCN_DTAG);
02029     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, 2, CCN_BLOB);
02030     ccn_charbuf_append_value(c, face->pktseq, 2);
02031     ccnb_element_end(c);
02032     if (0)
02033         ccnd_msg(h, "debug.%d pkt_to %u seq %u",
02034                  __LINE__, face->faceid, (unsigned)face->pktseq);
02035     face->pktseq++;
02036     face->flags &= ~CCN_FACE_SEQPROBE;
02037 }
02038 
02039 /**
02040  * Process an incoming link message.
02041  */
02042 static int
02043 process_incoming_link_message(struct ccnd_handle *h,
02044                               struct face *face, enum ccn_dtag dtag,
02045                               unsigned char *msg, size_t size)
02046 {
02047     uintmax_t s;
02048     int checkflags;
02049     int matchflags;
02050     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
02051     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder, msg, size);
02052 
02053     switch (dtag) {
02054         case CCN_DTAG_SequenceNumber:
02055             s = ccn_parse_required_tagged_binary_number(d, dtag, 1, 6);
02056             if (d->decoder.state < 0)
02057                 return(d->decoder.state);
02058             /*
02059              * If the other side is unicast and sends sequence numbers,
02060              * then it is OK for us to send numbers as well.
02061              */
02062             matchflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM;
02063             checkflags = matchflags | CCN_FACE_MCAST | CCN_FACE_SEQOK;
02064             if ((face->flags & checkflags) == matchflags)
02065                 face->flags |= CCN_FACE_SEQOK;
02066             if (face->rrun == 0) {
02067                 face->rseq = s;
02068                 face->rrun = 1;
02069                 return(0);
02070             }
02071             if (s == face->rseq + 1) {
02072                 face->rseq = s;
02073                 if (face->rrun < 255)
02074                     face->rrun++;
02075                 return(0);
02076             }
02077             if (s > face->rseq && s - face->rseq < 255) {
02078                 ccnd_msg(h, "seq_gap %u %ju to %ju",
02079                          face->faceid, face->rseq, s);
02080                 face->rseq = s;
02081                 face->rrun = 1;
02082                 return(0);
02083             }
02084             if (s <= face->rseq) {
02085                 if (face->rseq - s < face->rrun) {
02086                     ccnd_msg(h, "seq_dup %u %ju", face->faceid, s);
02087                     return(0);
02088                 }
02089                 if (face->rseq - s < 255) {
02090                     /* Received out of order */
02091                     ccnd_msg(h, "seq_ooo %u %ju", face->faceid, s);
02092                     if (s == face->rseq - face->rrun) {
02093                         face->rrun++;
02094                         return(0);
02095                     }
02096                 }
02097             }
02098             face->rseq = s;
02099             face->rrun = 1;
02100             break;
02101         default:
02102             return(-1);
02103     }
02104     return(0);
02105 }
02106 
02107 /**
02108  * Checks for inactivity on datagram faces.
02109  * @returns number of faces that have gone away.
02110  */
02111 static int
02112 check_dgram_faces(struct ccnd_handle *h)
02113 {
02114     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
02115     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
02116     int count = 0;
02117     int checkflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM;
02118     int wantflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM;
02119     int adj_req = 0;
02120     
02121     hashtb_start(h->dgram_faces, e);
02122     while (e->data != NULL) {
02123         struct face *face = e->data;
02124         if (face->addr != NULL && (face->flags & checkflags) == wantflags) {
02125             face->flags &= ~CCN_FACE_LC; /* Rate limit link check interests */
02126             if (face->recvcount == 0) {
02127                 if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_PERMANENT | CCN_FACE_ADJ)) == 0) {
02128                     count += 1;
02129                     hashtb_delete(e);
02130                     continue;
02131                 }
02132             }
02133             else if (face->recvcount == 1) {
02134                 face->recvcount = 0;
02135             }
02136             else {
02137                 face->recvcount = 1; /* go around twice */
02138             }
02139         }
02140         hashtb_next(e);
02141     }
02142     hashtb_end(e);
02143     if (adj_req) {
02144         process_internal_client_buffer(h);
02145     }
02146     return(count);
02147 }
02148 
02149 /**
02150  * Destroys the face identified by faceid.
02151  * @returns 0 for success, -1 for failure.
02152  */
02153 int
02154 ccnd_destroy_face(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid)
02155 {
02156     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
02157     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
02158     struct face *face;
02159     int dgram_chk = CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_MCAST;
02160     int dgram_want = CCN_FACE_DGRAM;
02161     
02162     face = face_from_faceid(h, faceid);
02163     if (face == NULL)
02164         return(-1);
02165     if ((face->flags & dgram_chk) == dgram_want) {
02166         hashtb_start(h->dgram_faces, e);
02167         hashtb_seek(e, face->addr, face->addrlen, 0);
02168         if (e->data == face)
02169             face = NULL;
02170         hashtb_delete(e);
02171         hashtb_end(e);
02172         if (face == NULL)
02173             return(0);
02174     }
02175     shutdown_client_fd(h, face->recv_fd);
02176     face = NULL;
02177     return(0);
02178 }
02179 
02180 /**
02181  * Remove expired faces from *ip
02182  */
02183 static void
02184 check_forward_to(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct ccn_indexbuf **ip)
02185 {
02186     struct ccn_indexbuf *ft = *ip;
02187     int i;
02188     int j;
02189     if (ft == NULL)
02190         return;
02191     for (i = 0; i < ft->n; i++)
02192         if (face_from_faceid(h, ft->buf[i]) == NULL)
02193             break;
02194     for (j = i + 1; j < ft->n; j++)
02195         if (face_from_faceid(h, ft->buf[j]) != NULL)
02196             ft->buf[i++] = ft->buf[j];
02197     if (i == 0)
02198         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(ip);
02199     else if (i < ft->n)
02200         ft->n = i;
02201 }
02202 
02203 /**
02204  * Ages src info and retires unused nameprefix entries.
02205  * @returns number that have gone away.
02206  */
02207 static int
02208 check_nameprefix_entries(struct ccnd_handle *h)
02209 {
02210     int count = 0;
02211     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
02212     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
02213     struct ielinks *head;
02214     struct nameprefix_entry *npe;    
02215     
02216     hashtb_start(h->nameprefix_tab, e);
02217     for (npe = e->data; npe != NULL; npe = e->data) {
02218         if (  npe->src == CCN_NOFACEID &&
02219               npe->children == 0 &&
02220               npe->forwarding == NULL) {
02221             head = &npe->ie_head;
02222             if (head == head->next) {
02223                 count += 1;
02224                 if (npe->parent != NULL) {
02225                     npe->parent->children--;
02226                     npe->parent = NULL;
02227                 }
02228                 hashtb_delete(e);
02229                 continue;
02230             }
02231         }
02232         check_forward_to(h, &npe->forward_to);
02233         check_forward_to(h, &npe->tap);
02234         npe->osrc = npe->src;
02235         npe->src = CCN_NOFACEID;
02236         hashtb_next(e);
02237     }
02238     hashtb_end(e);
02239     return(count);
02240 }
02241 
02242 static void
02243 check_comm_file(struct ccnd_handle *h)
02244 {
02245     if (!comm_file_ok()) {
02246         ccnd_msg(h, "stopping (%s gone)", unlink_this_at_exit);
02247         unlink_this_at_exit = NULL;
02248         h->running = 0;
02249     }
02250 }
02251 
02252 /**
02253  * Scheduled reap event for retiring expired structures.
02254  */
02255 static int
02256 reap(
02257     struct ccn_schedule *sched,
02258     void *clienth,
02259     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
02260     int flags)
02261 {
02262     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
02263     (void)(sched);
02264     (void)(ev);
02265     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0) {
02266         h->reaper = NULL;
02267         return(0);
02268     }
02269     check_dgram_faces(h);
02270     check_nameprefix_entries(h);
02271     check_comm_file(h);
02272     return(2 * CCN_INTEREST_LIFETIME_MICROSEC);
02273 }
02274 
02275 static void
02276 reap_needed(struct ccnd_handle *h, int init_delay_usec)
02277 {
02278     if (h->reaper == NULL)
02279         h->reaper = ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, init_delay_usec, reap, NULL, 0);
02280 }
02281 
02282 /**
02283  * Remove a content object from the store
02284  */
02285 static int
02286 remove_content(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
02287 {
02288     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
02289     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
02290     int res;
02291     if (content == NULL)
02292         return(-1);
02293     hashtb_start(h->content_tab, e);
02294     res = hashtb_seek(e, content->key,
02295                       content->key_size, content->size - content->key_size);
02296     if (res != HT_OLD_ENTRY)
02297         abort();
02298     if ((content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE) != 0)
02299         h->n_stale--;
02300     if (h->debug & 4)
02301         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "remove", NULL,
02302                         content->key, content->size);
02303     hashtb_delete(e);
02304     hashtb_end(e);
02305     return(0);
02306 }
02307 
02308 /**
02309  * Periodic content cleaning
02310  */
02311 static int
02312 clean_daemon(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
02313              void *clienth,
02314              struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
02315              int flags)
02316 {
02317     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
02318     (void)(sched);
02319     (void)(ev);
02320     unsigned long n;
02321     ccn_accession_t limit;
02322     ccn_accession_t a;
02323     ccn_accession_t min_stale;
02324     int check_limit = 500;  /* Do not run for too long at once */
02325     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
02326     int res = 0;
02327     int ignore;
02328     int i;
02329     
02330     /*
02331      * If we ran into our processing limit (check_limit) last time,
02332      * ev->evint tells us where to restart.
02333      */
02334     
02335     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0) {
02336         h->clean = NULL;
02337         return(0);
02338     }
02339     n = hashtb_n(h->content_tab);
02340     if (n <= h->capacity) {
02341         h->clean = NULL;
02342         return(0);
02343     }
02344     /* Toss unsolicited content first */
02345     for (i = 0; i < h->unsol->n; i++) {
02346         if (i == check_limit) {
02347             for (i = check_limit; i < h->unsol->n; i++)
02348                 h->unsol->buf[i-check_limit] = h->unsol->buf[i];
02349             h->unsol->n -= check_limit;
02350             return(500);
02351         }
02352         a = h->unsol->buf[i];
02353         content = content_from_accession(h, a);
02354         if (content != NULL &&
02355             (content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_PRECIOUS) == 0)
02356             remove_content(h, content);
02357     }
02358     h->unsol->n = 0;
02359     n = hashtb_n(h->content_tab);
02360     if (h->min_stale <= h->max_stale) {
02361         /* clean out stale content next */
02362         limit = h->max_stale;
02363         if (limit > h->accession)
02364             limit = h->accession;
02365         min_stale = ~0;
02366         a = ev->evint;
02367         if (a <= h->min_stale || a > h->max_stale)
02368             a = h->min_stale;
02369         else
02370             min_stale = h->min_stale;
02371         for (; a <= limit && n > h->capacity; a++) {
02372             if (check_limit-- <= 0) {
02373                 ev->evint = a;
02374                 break;
02375             }
02376             content = content_from_accession(h, a);
02377             if (content != NULL &&
02378                   (content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE) != 0) {
02379                 res = remove_content(h, content);
02380                 if (res < 0) {
02381                     if (a < min_stale)
02382                         min_stale = a;
