04371             ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "stale", NULL,
04372                             content->key, content->size);
04373     content->flags |= CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE;
04374     h->n_stale++;
04375     if (accession < h->min_stale)
04376         h->min_stale = accession;
04377     if (accession > h->max_stale)
04378         h->max_stale = accession;
04379 }
04380 
04381 /**
04382  * Scheduled event that makes content stale when its FreshnessSeconds
04383  * has exported.
04384  *
04385  * May actually remove the content if we are over quota.
04386  */
04387 static int
04388 expire_content(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
04389                void *clienth,
04390                struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
04391                int flags)
04392 {
04393     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
04394     ccn_accession_t accession = ev->evint;
04395     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
04396     int res;
04397     unsigned n;
04398     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0)
04399         return(0);
04400     content = content_from_accession(h, accession);
04401     if (content != NULL) {
04402         n = hashtb_n(h->content_tab);
04403         /* The fancy test here lets existing stale content go away, too. */
04404         if ((n - (n >> 3)) > h->capacity ||
04405             (n > h->capacity && h->min_stale > h->max_stale)) {
04406             res = remove_content(h, content);
04407             if (res == 0)
04408                 return(0);
04409         }
04410         mark_stale(h, content);
04411     }
04412     return(0);
04413 }
04414 
04415 /**
04416  * Schedules content expiration based on its FreshnessSeconds, and the
04417  * configured default and limit.
04418  */
04419 static void
04420 set_content_timer(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content,
04421                   struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco)
04422 {
04423     int seconds = 0;
04424     int microseconds = 0;
04425     size_t start = pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_FreshnessSeconds];
04426     size_t stop  = pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_FreshnessSeconds];
04427     if (h->force_zero_freshness) {
04428         /* Keep around for long enough to make it through the queues */
04429         microseconds = 8 * h->data_pause_microsec + 10000;
04430         goto Finish;
04431     }
04432     if (start == stop)
04433         seconds = h->tts_default;
04434     else
04435         seconds = ccn_fetch_tagged_nonNegativeInteger(
04436                 CCN_DTAG_FreshnessSeconds,
04437                 content->key,
04438                 start, stop);
04439     if (seconds <= 0 || (h->tts_limit > 0 && seconds > h->tts_limit))
04440         seconds = h->tts_limit;
04441     if (seconds <= 0)
04442         return;
04443     if (seconds > ((1U<<31) / 1000000)) {
04444         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "FreshnessSeconds_too_large", NULL,
04445             content->key, pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E]);
04446         return;
04447     }
04448     microseconds = seconds * 1000000;
04449 Finish:
04450     ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, microseconds,
04451                        &expire_content, NULL, content->accession);
04452 }
04453 
04454 /**
04455  * Process an arriving ContentObject.
04456  *
04457  * Parse the ContentObject and discard if it is not well-formed.
04458  *
04459  * Compute the digest.
04460  *
04461  * Look it up in the content store.  It it is already there, but is stale,
04462  * make it fresh again.  If it is not there, add it.
04463  *
04464  * Find the matching pending interests in the PIT and consume them,
04465  * queueing the ContentObject to be sent on the associated faces.
04466  * If no matches were found and the content object was new, discard remove it
04467  * from the store.
04468  *
04469  * XXX - the change to staleness should also not happen if there was no
04470  * matching PIT entry.
04471  */
04472 static void
04473 process_incoming_content(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face,
04474                          unsigned char *wire_msg, size_t wire_size)
04475 {
04476     unsigned char *msg;
04477     size_t size;
04478     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
04479     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
04480     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject obj = {0};
04481     int res;
04482     size_t keysize = 0;
04483     size_t tailsize = 0;
04484     unsigned char *tail = NULL;
04485     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
04486     int i;
04487     struct ccn_indexbuf *comps = indexbuf_obtain(h);
04488     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = charbuf_obtain(h);
04489     
04490     msg = wire_msg;
04491     size = wire_size;
04492     
04493     res = ccn_parse_ContentObject(msg, size, &obj, comps);
04494     if (res < 0) {
04495         ccnd_msg(h, "error parsing ContentObject - code %d", res);
04496         goto Bail;
04497     }
04498     ccnd_meter_bump(h, face->meter[FM_DATI], 1);
04499     if (comps->n < 1 ||
04500         (keysize = comps->buf[comps->n - 1]) > 65535 - 36) {
04501         ccnd_msg(h, "ContentObject with keysize %lu discarded",
04502                  (unsigned long)keysize);
04503         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "oversize", face, msg, size);
04504         res = -__LINE__;
04505         goto Bail;
04506     }
04507     /* Make the ContentObject-digest name component explicit */
04508     ccn_digest_ContentObject(msg, &obj);
04509     if (obj.digest_bytes != 32) {
04510         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "indigestible", face, msg, size);
04511         goto Bail;
04512     }
04513     i = comps->buf[comps->n - 1];
04514     ccn_charbuf_append(cb, msg, i);
04515     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(cb, CCN_DTAG_Component, CCN_DTAG);
04516     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(cb, obj.digest_bytes, CCN_BLOB);
04517     ccn_charbuf_append(cb, obj.digest, obj.digest_bytes);
04518     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(cb);
04519     ccn_charbuf_append(cb, msg + i, size - i);
04520     msg = cb->buf;
04521     size = cb->length;
04522     res = ccn_parse_ContentObject(msg, size, &obj, comps);
04523     if (res < 0) abort(); /* must have just messed up */
04524     
04525     if (obj.magic != 20090415) {
04526         if (++(h->oldformatcontent) == h->oldformatcontentgrumble) {
04527             h->oldformatcontentgrumble *= 10;
04528             ccnd_msg(h, "downrev content items received: %d (%d)",
04529                      h->oldformatcontent,
04530                      obj.magic);
04531         }
04532     }
04533     if (h->debug & 4)
04534         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "content_from", face, msg, size);
04535     keysize = obj.offset[CCN_PCO_B_Content];
04536     tail = msg + keysize;
04537     tailsize = size - keysize;
04538     hashtb_start(h->content_tab, e);
04539     res = hashtb_seek(e, msg, keysize, tailsize);
04540     content = e->data;
04541     if (res == HT_OLD_ENTRY) {
04542         if (tailsize != e->extsize ||
04543               0 != memcmp(tail, ((unsigned char *)e->key) + keysize, tailsize)) {
04544             ccnd_msg(h, "ContentObject name collision!!!!!");
04545             ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "new", face, msg, size);
04546             ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "old", NULL, e->key, e->keysize + e->extsize);
04547             content = NULL;
04548             hashtb_delete(e); /* XXX - Mercilessly throw away both of them. */
04549             res = -__LINE__;
04550         }
04551         else if ((content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE) != 0) {
04552             /* When old content arrives after it has gone stale, freshen it */
04553             // XXX - ought to do mischief checks before this
04554             content->flags &= ~CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE;
04555             h->n_stale--;
04556             set_content_timer(h, content, &obj);
04557             /* Record the new arrival face only if the old face is gone */
04558             // XXX - it is not clear that this is the most useful choice
04559             if (face_from_faceid(h, content->arrival_faceid) == NULL)
04560                 content->arrival_faceid = face->faceid;
04561             // XXX - no counter for this case
04562         }
04563         else {
04564             h->content_dups_recvd++;
04565             ccnd_msg(h, "received duplicate ContentObject from %u (accession %llu)",
04566                      face->faceid, (unsigned long long)content->accession);
04567             ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "dup", face, msg, size);
04568         }
04569     }
04570     else if (res == HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
04571         unsigned long n = hashtb_n(h->content_tab);
04572         if (n > h->capacity + (h->capacity >> 3))
04573             clean_needed(h);
04574         content->accession = ++(h->accession);
04575         content->arrival_faceid = face->faceid;
04576         enroll_content(h, content);
04577         if (content == content_from_accession(h, content->accession)) {
04578             content->ncomps = comps->n;
04579             content->comps = calloc(comps->n, sizeof(comps[0]));
04580             if (content->comps == NULL) {
04581                 ccnd_msg(h, "could not enroll ContentObject (accession %llu)",
04582                          (unsigned long long)content->accession);
04583                 content = NULL;
04584                 hashtb_delete(e);
04585                 res = -__LINE__;
04586                 hashtb_end(e);
04587                 goto Bail;
04588             }
04589         }
04590         content->key_size = e->keysize;
04591         content->size = e->keysize + e->extsize;
04592         content->key = e->key;
04593         for (i = 0; i < comps->n; i++)
04594             content->comps[i] = comps->buf[i];
04595         content_skiplist_insert(h, content);
04596         set_content_timer(h, content, &obj);
04597         /* Mark public keys supplied at startup as precious. */
04598         if (obj.type == CCN_CONTENT_KEY && content->accession <= (h->capacity + 7)/8)
04599             content->flags |= CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_PRECIOUS;
04600     }
04601     hashtb_end(e);
04602 Bail:
04603     indexbuf_release(h, comps);
04604     charbuf_release(h, cb);
04605     cb = NULL;
04606     if (res >= 0 && content != NULL) {
04607         int n_matches;
04608         enum cq_delay_class c;
04609         struct content_queue *q;
04610         n_matches = match_interests(h, content, &obj, NULL, face);
04611         if (res == HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
04612             if (n_matches < 0) {
04613                 remove_content(h, content);
04614                 return;
04615             }
04616             if (n_matches == 0 && (face->flags & CCN_FACE_GG) == 0) {
04617                 content->flags |= CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_SLOWSEND;
04618                 ccn_indexbuf_append_element(h->unsol, content->accession);
04619             }
04620         }
04621         // ZZZZ - review whether the following is actually needed
04622         for (c = 0; c < CCN_CQ_N; c++) {
04623             q = face->q[c];
04624             if (q != NULL) {
04625                 i = ccn_indexbuf_member(q->send_queue, content->accession);
04626                 if (i >= 0) {
04627                     /*
04628                      * In the case this consumed any interests from this source,
04629                      * don't send the content back
04630                      */
04631                     if (h->debug & 8)
04632                         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "content_nosend", face, msg, size);
04633                     q->send_queue->buf[i] = 0;
04634                 }
04635             }
04636         }
04637     }
04638 }
04639 
04640 /**
04641  * Process an incoming message.
04642  *
04643  * This is where we decide whether we have an Interest message,
04644  * a ContentObject, or something else.
04645  */
04646 static void
04647 process_input_message(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face,
04648                       unsigned char *msg, size_t size, int pdu_ok)
04649 {
04650     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder decoder = {0};
04651     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder *d = &decoder;
04652     ssize_t dres;
04653     enum ccn_dtag dtag;
04654     
04655     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED) != 0) {
04656         face->flags &= ~CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED;
04657         if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_LOOPBACK) != 0)
04658             face->flags |= CCN_FACE_GG;
04659         /* YYY This is the first place that we know that an inbound stream face is speaking CCNx protocol. */
04660         register_new_face(h, face);
04661     }
04662     d->state |= CCN_DSTATE_PAUSE;
04663     dres = ccn_skeleton_decode(d, msg, size);
04664     if (d->state < 0)
04665         abort(); /* cannot happen because of checks in caller */
04666     if (CCN_GET_TT_FROM_DSTATE(d->state) != CCN_DTAG) {
04667         ccnd_msg(h, "discarding unknown message; size = %lu", (unsigned long)size);
04668         // XXX - keep a count?
04669         return;
04670     }
04671     dtag = d->numval;
04672     switch (dtag) {
04673         case CCN_DTAG_CCNProtocolDataUnit:
04674             if (!pdu_ok)
04675                 break;
04676             size -= d->index;
04677             if (size > 0)
04678                 size--;
04679             msg += d->index;
04680             if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_LINK | CCN_FACE_GG)) != CCN_FACE_LINK) {
04681                 face->flags |= CCN_FACE_LINK;
04682                 face->flags &= ~CCN_FACE_GG;
04683                 register_new_face(h, face);
04684             }
04685             memset(d, 0, sizeof(*d));
04686             while (d->index < size) {
04687                 dres = ccn_skeleton_decode(d, msg + d->index, size - d->index);
04688                 if (d->state != 0)
04689                     abort(); /* cannot happen because of checks in caller */
04690                 /* The pdu_ok parameter limits the recursion depth */
04691                 process_input_message(h, face, msg + d->index - dres, dres, 0);
04692             }
04693             return;
04694         case CCN_DTAG_Interest:
04695             process_incoming_interest(h, face, msg, size);
04696             return;
04697         case CCN_DTAG_ContentObject:
04698             process_incoming_content(h, face, msg, size);
04699             return;
04700         case CCN_DTAG_SequenceNumber:
04701             process_incoming_link_message(h, face, dtag, msg, size);
04702             return;
04703         default:
04704             break;
04705     }
04706     ccnd_msg(h, "discarding unknown message; dtag=%u, size = %lu",
04707              (unsigned)dtag,
04708              (unsigned long)size);
04709 }
04710 
04711 /**
04712  * Log a notification that a new datagram face has been created.
04713  */
04714 static void
04715 ccnd_new_face_msg(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face)
04716 {
04717     const struct sockaddr *addr = face->addr;
04718     int port = 0;
04719     const unsigned char *rawaddr = NULL;
04720     char printable[80];
04721     const char *peer = NULL;
04722     if (addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
04723         const struct sockaddr_in6 *addr6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)addr;
04724         rawaddr = (const unsigned char *)&addr6->sin6_addr;
04725         port = htons(addr6->sin6_port);
04726     }
04727     else if (addr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
04728         const struct sockaddr_in *addr4 = (struct sockaddr_in *)addr;
04729         rawaddr = (const unsigned char *)&addr4->sin_addr.s_addr;
04730         port = htons(addr4->sin_port);
04731     }
04732     if (rawaddr != NULL)
04733         peer = inet_ntop(addr->sa_family, rawaddr, printable, sizeof(printable));
04734     if (peer == NULL)
04735         peer = "(unknown)";
04736     ccnd_msg(h,
04737              "accepted datagram client id=%d (flags=0x%x) %s port %d",
04738              face->faceid, face->flags, peer, port);
04739 }
04740 
04741 /**
04742  * Since struct sockaddr_in6 may contain fields that should not participate
04743  * in comparison / hash, ensure the undesired fields are zero.
04744  *
04745  * Per RFC 3493, sin6_flowinfo is zeroed.
04746  *
04747  * @param addr is the sockaddr (any family)
04748  * @param addrlen is its length
04749  * @param space points to a buffer that may be used for the result.
04750  * @returns either the original addr or a pointer to a scrubbed copy.
04751  *
04752  */
04753 static struct sockaddr *
04754 scrub_sockaddr(struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t addrlen,
04755                struct sockaddr_in6 *space)
04756 {
04757     struct sockaddr_in6 *src;
04758     struct sockaddr_in6 *dst;
04759     if (addr->sa_family != AF_INET6 || addrlen != sizeof(*space))
04760         return(addr);
04761     dst = space;
04762     src = (void *)addr;
04763     memset(dst, 0, addrlen);
04764     /* Copy first byte case sin6_len is used. */
04765     ((uint8_t *)dst)[0] = ((uint8_t *)src)[0];
04766     dst->sin6_family   = src->sin6_family;
04767     dst->sin6_port     = src->sin6_port;
04768     dst->sin6_addr     = src->sin6_addr;
04769     dst->sin6_scope_id = src->sin6_scope_id;
04770     return((struct sockaddr *)dst);
04771 }
04772 
04773 /**
04774  * Get (or create) the face associated with a given sockaddr.
04775  */
04776 static struct face *
04777 get_dgram_source(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face,
04778                  struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t addrlen, int why)
04779 {
04780     struct face *source = NULL;
04781     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
04782     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
04783     struct sockaddr_in6 space;
04784     int res;
04785     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) == 0)
04786         return(face);
04787     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_MCAST) != 0)
04788         return(face);
04789     hashtb_start(h->dgram_faces, e);
04790     res = hashtb_seek(e, scrub_sockaddr(addr, addrlen, &space), addrlen, 0);
04791     if (res >= 0) {
04792         source = e->data;
04793         source->recvcount++;
04794         if (source->addr == NULL) {
04795             source->addr = e->key;
04796             source->addrlen = e->keysize;
04797             source->recv_fd = face->recv_fd;
04798             source->sendface = face->faceid;
04799             init_face_flags(h, source, CCN_FACE_DGRAM);
04800             if (why == 1 && (source->flags & CCN_FACE_LOOPBACK) != 0)
04801                 source->flags |= CCN_FACE_GG;
04802             res = enroll_face(h, source);
04803             if (res == -1) {
04804                 hashtb_delete(e);
04805                 source = NULL;
04806             }
04807             else
04808                 ccnd_new_face_msg(h, source);
04809         }
04810     }
04811     hashtb_end(e);
04812     return(source);
04813 }
04814 
04815 /**
04816  * Break up data in a face's input buffer buffer into individual messages,
04817  * and call process_input_message on each one.
04818  *
04819  * This is used to handle things originating from the internal client -
04820  * its output is input for face 0.
04821  */
04822 static void
04823 process_input_buffer(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face)
04824 {
04825     unsigned char *msg;
04826     size_t size;
04827     ssize_t dres;
04828     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder *d;
04829 
04830     if (face == NULL || face->inbuf == NULL)
04831         return;
04832     d = &face->decoder;
04833     msg = face->inbuf->buf;
04834     size = face->inbuf->length;
04835     while (d->index < size) {
04836         dres = ccn_skeleton_decode(d, msg + d->index, size - d->index);
04837         if (d->state != 0)
04838             break;
04839         process_input_message(h, face, msg + d->index - dres, dres, 0);
04840     }
04841     if (d->index != size) {
04842         ccnd_msg(h, "protocol error on face %u (state %d), discarding %d bytes",
04843                      face->faceid, d->state, (int)(size - d->index));
04844         // XXX - perhaps this should be a fatal error.
04845     }
04846     face->inbuf->length = 0;
04847     memset(d, 0, sizeof(*d));
04848 }
04849 
04850 /**
04851  * Process the input from a socket.
04852  *
04853  * The socket has been found ready for input by the poll call.
04854  * Decide what face it corresponds to, and after checking for exceptional
04855  * cases, receive data, parse it into ccnb-encoded messages, and call
04856  * process_input_message for each one.
04857  */
04858 static void
04859 process_input(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd)
04860 {
04861     struct face *face = NULL;
04862     struct face *source = NULL;
04863     ssize_t res;
04864     ssize_t dres;
04865     ssize_t msgstart;
04866     unsigned char *buf;
04867     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder *d;
04868     struct sockaddr_storage sstor;
04869     socklen_t addrlen = sizeof(sstor);
04870     struct sockaddr *addr = (struct sockaddr *)&sstor;
04871     int err = 0;
04872     socklen_t err_sz;
04873     
04874     face = hashtb_lookup(h->faces_by_fd, &fd, sizeof(fd));
04875     if (face == NULL)
04876         return;
04877     if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE)) == CCN_FACE_PASSIVE) {
04878         accept_connection(h, fd);
04879         check_comm_file(h);
04880         return;
04881     }
04882     err_sz = sizeof(err);
04883     res = getsockopt(face->recv_fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_ERROR, &err, &err_sz);
04884     if (res >= 0 && err != 0) {
04885         ccnd_msg(h, "error on face %u: %s (%d)", face->faceid, strerror(err), err);
04886         if (err == ETIMEDOUT && (face->flags & CCN_FACE_CONNECTING) != 0) {
04887             shutdown_client_fd(h, fd);
04888             return;
04889         }
04890     }
04891     d = &face->decoder;
04892     if (face->inbuf == NULL)
04893         face->inbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
04894     if (face->inbuf->length == 0)
04895         memset(d, 0, sizeof(*d));
04896     buf = ccn_charbuf_reserve(face->inbuf, 8800);
04897     memset(&sstor, 0, sizeof(sstor));
04898     res = recvfrom(face->recv_fd, buf, face->inbuf->limit - face->inbuf->length,
04899             /* flags */ 0, addr, &addrlen);
04900     if (res == -1)
04901         ccnd_msg(h, "recvfrom face %u :%s (errno = %d)",
04902                     face->faceid, strerror(errno), errno);
04903     else if (res == 0 && (face->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) == 0)
04904         shutdown_client_fd(h, fd);
04905     else {
04906         source = get_dgram_source(h, face, addr, addrlen, (res == 1) ? 1 : 2);
04907         ccnd_meter_bump(h, source->meter[FM_BYTI], res);
04908         source->recvcount++;
04909         source->surplus = 0; // XXX - we don't actually use this, except for some obscure messages.
04910         if (res <= 1 && (source->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) != 0) {
04911             // XXX - If the initial heartbeat gets missed, we don't realize the locality of the face.
04912             if (h->debug & 128)
04913                 ccnd_msg(h, "%d-byte heartbeat on %d", (int)res, source->faceid);
04914             return;
04915         }
04916         face->inbuf->length += res;
04917         msgstart = 0;
04918         if (((face->flags & CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED) != 0 &&
04919              face->inbuf->length >= 6 &&
04920              0 == memcmp(face->inbuf->buf, "GET ", 4))) {
04921             ccnd_stats_handle_http_connection(h, face);
04922             return;
04923         }
04924         dres = ccn_skeleton_decode(d, buf, res);
04925         while (d->state == 0) {
04926             process_input_message(h, source,
04927                                   face->inbuf->buf + msgstart,
04928                                   d->index - msgstart,
04929                                   (face->flags & CCN_FACE_LOCAL) != 0);
04930             msgstart = d->index;
04931             if (msgstart == face->inbuf->length) {
04932                 face->inbuf->length = 0;
04933                 return;
04934             }
04935             dres = ccn_skeleton_decode(d,
04936                     face->inbuf->buf + d->index, // XXX - msgstart and d->index are the same here - use msgstart
04937                     res = face->inbuf->length - d->index);  // XXX - why is res set here?
04938         }
04939         if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) != 0) {
04940             ccnd_msg(h, "protocol error on face %u, discarding %u bytes",
04941                 source->faceid,
04942                 (unsigned)(face->inbuf->length));  // XXX - Should be face->inbuf->length - d->index (or msgstart)
04943             face->inbuf->length = 0;
04944             /* XXX - should probably ignore this source for a while */
04945             return;
04946         }
04947         else if (d->state < 0) {
04948             ccnd_msg(h, "protocol error on face %u", source->faceid);
04949             shutdown_client_fd(h, fd);
04950             return;
04951         }
04952         if (msgstart < face->inbuf->length && msgstart > 0) {
04953             /* move partial message to start of buffer */
04954             memmove(face->inbuf->buf, face->inbuf->buf + msgstart,
04955                 face->inbuf->length - msgstart);
04956             face->inbuf->length -= msgstart;
04957             d->index -= msgstart;
04958         }
04959     }
04960 }
04961 
04962 /**
04963  * Process messages from our internal client.
04964  *
04965  * The internal client's output is input to us.
04966  */
04967 static void
04968 process_internal_client_buffer(struct ccnd_handle *h)
04969 {
04970     struct face *face = h->face0;
04971     if (face == NULL)
04972         return;
04973     face->inbuf = ccn_grab_buffered_output(h->internal_client);
04974     if (face->inbuf == NULL)
04975         return;
04976     ccnd_meter_bump(h, face->meter[FM_BYTI], face->inbuf->length);
04977     process_input_buffer(h, face);
04978     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&(face->inbuf));
04979 }
04980 
04981 /**
04982  * Scheduled event for deferred processing of internal client
04983  */
04984 static int
04985 process_icb_action(
04986     struct ccn_schedule *sched,
04987     void *clienth,
04988     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
04989     int flags)
04990 {
04991     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
04992     
04993     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0)
04994         return(0);
04995     process_internal_client_buffer(h);
04996     return(0);
04997 }
04998 
04999 /**
05000  * Schedule the processing of internal client results
05001  *
05002  * This little dance keeps us from destroying an interest
05003  * entry while we are in the middle of processing it.
05004  */
05005 void
05006 ccnd_internal_client_has_somthing_to_say(struct ccnd_handle *h)
05007 {
05008     ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, 0, process_icb_action, NULL, 0);
05009 }
05010 
05011 /**
05012  * Handle errors after send() or sendto().
05013  * @returns -1 if error has been dealt with, or 0 to defer sending.
05014  */
05015 static int
05016 handle_send_error(struct ccnd_handle *h, int errnum, struct face *face,
05017                   const void *data, size_t size)
05018 {
05019     int res = -1;
05020     if (errnum == EAGAIN) {
05021         res = 0;
05022     }
05023     else if (errnum == EPIPE) {
05024         face->flags |= CCN_FACE_NOSEND;
05025         face->outbufindex = 0;
05026         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->outbuf);
05027     }
05028     else {
05029         ccnd_msg(h, "send to face %u failed: %s (errno = %d)",
05030                  face->faceid, strerror(errnum), errnum);
05031         if (errnum == EISCONN)
05032             res = 0;
05033     }
05034     return(res);
05035 }
05036 
05037 /**
05038  * Determine what socket to use to send on a face.
05039  *
05040  * For streams, this just returns the associated fd.
05041  *
05042  * For datagrams, one fd may be in use for many faces, so we need to find the
05043  * right one to use.
05044  *
05045  * This is not as smart as it should be for situations where
05046  * CCND_LISTEN_ON has been specified.
05047  */
05048 static int
05049 sending_fd(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face)
05050 {
05051     struct face *out = NULL;
05052     if (face->sendface == face->faceid)
05053         return(face->recv_fd);
05054     out = face_from_faceid(h, face->sendface);
05055     if (out != NULL)
05056         return(out->recv_fd);
05057     face->sendface = CCN_NOFACEID;
05058     if (face->addr != NULL) {
05059         switch (face->addr->sa_family) {
05060             case AF_INET:
05061                 face->sendface = h->ipv4_faceid;
05062                 break;
05063             case AF_INET6:
05064                 face->sendface = h->ipv6_faceid;
05065                 break;
05066             default:
05067                 break;
05068         }
05069     }
05070     out = face_from_faceid(h, face->sendface);
05071     if (out != NULL)
05072         return(out->recv_fd);
05073     return(-1);
05074 }
05075 
05076 /**
05077  * Send data to the face.
05078  *
05079  * No direct error result is provided; the face state is updated as needed.
05080  */
05081 void
05082 ccnd_send(struct ccnd_handle *h,
05083           struct face *face,
05084           const void *data, size_t size)
05085 {
05086     ssize_t res;
05087     int fd;
05088     int bcast = 0;
05089     
05090     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_NOSEND) != 0)
05091         return;
05092     face->surplus++;
05093     if (face->outbuf != NULL) {
05094         ccn_charbuf_append(face->outbuf, data, size);
05095         return;
05096     }
05097     if (face == h->face0) {
05098         ccnd_meter_bump(h, face->meter[FM_BYTO], size);
05099         ccn_dispatch_message(h->internal_client, (void *)data, size);
05100         ccnd_internal_client_has_somthing_to_say(h);
05101         return;
05102     }
05103     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) == 0)
05104         res = send(face->recv_fd, data, size, 0);
05105     else {
05106         fd = sending_fd(h, face);
05107         if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_BC) != 0) {
05108             bcast = 1;
05109             setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_BROADCAST, &bcast, sizeof(bcast));
05110         }
05111         res = sendto(fd, data, size, 0, face->addr, face->addrlen);
05112         if (res == -1 && errno == EACCES &&
05113             (face->flags & (CCN_FACE_BC | CCN_FACE_NBC)) == 0) {
05114             bcast = 1;
05115             setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_BROADCAST, &bcast, sizeof(bcast));
05116             res = sendto(fd, data, size, 0, face->addr, face->addrlen);
05117             if (res == -1)
05118                 face->flags |= CCN_FACE_NBC; /* did not work, do not try */
05119             else
05120                 face->flags |= CCN_FACE_BC; /* remember for next time */
05121         }
05122         if (bcast != 0) {
05123             bcast = 0;
05124             setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_BROADCAST, &bcast, sizeof(bcast));
05125         }
05126     }
05127     if (res > 0)
05128         ccnd_meter_bump(h, face->meter[FM_BYTO], res);
05129     if (res == size)
05130         return;
05131     if (res == -1) {
05132         res = handle_send_error(h, errno, face, data, size);
05133         if (res == -1)
05134             return;
05135     }
05136     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) != 0) {
05137         ccnd_msg(h, "sendto short");
05138         return;
05139     }
05140     face->outbufindex = 0;
05141     face->outbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
05142     if (face->outbuf == NULL) {
05143         ccnd_msg(h, "do_write: %s", strerror(errno));
05144         return;
05145     }
05146     ccn_charbuf_append(face->outbuf,
05147                        ((const unsigned char *)data) + res, size - res);
05148 }
05149 
05150 /**
05151  * Do deferred sends.
05152  *
05153  * These can only happen on streams, after there has been a partial write.
05154  */
05155 static void
05156 do_deferred_write(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd)
05157 {
05158     /* This only happens on connected sockets */
05159     ssize_t res;
05160     struct face *face = hashtb_lookup(h->faces_by_fd, &fd, sizeof(fd));
05161     if (face == NULL)
05162         return;
05163     if (face->outbuf != NULL) {
05164         ssize_t sendlen = face->outbuf->length - face->outbufindex;
05165         if (sendlen > 0) {
05166             res = send(fd, face->outbuf->buf + face->outbufindex, sendlen, 0);
05167             if (res == -1) {
05168                 if (errno == EPIPE) {
05169                     face->flags |= CCN_FACE_NOSEND;
05170                     face->outbufindex = 0;
05171                     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->outbuf);
05172                     return;
05173                 }
05174                 ccnd_msg(h, "send: %s (errno = %d)", strerror(errno), errno);
05175                 shutdown_client_fd(h, fd);
05176                 return;
05177             }
05178             if (res == sendlen) {
05179                 face->outbufindex = 0;
05180                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->outbuf);
05181                 if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_CLOSING) != 0)
05182                     shutdown_client_fd(h, fd);
05183                 return;
05184             }
05185             face->outbufindex += res;
05186             return;
05187         }
05188         face->outbufindex = 0;
05189         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->outbuf);
05190     }
05191     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_CLOSING) != 0)
05192         shutdown_client_fd(h, fd);
05193     else if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_CONNECTING) != 0) {
05194         face->flags &= ~CCN_FACE_CONNECTING;
05195         ccnd_face_status_change(h, face->faceid);
05196     }
05197     else
05198         ccnd_msg(h, "ccnd:do_deferred_write: something fishy on %d", fd);
05199 }
05200 
05201 /**
05202  * Set up the array of fd descriptors for the poll(2) call.
05203  *
05204  * Arrange the array so that multicast receivers are early, so that
05205  * if the same packet arrives on both a multicast socket and a
05206  * normal socket, we will count is as multicast.
05207  */
05208 static void
05209 prepare_poll_fds(struct ccnd_handle *h)
05210 {
05211     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
05212     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
05213     int i, j, k;
05214     if (hashtb_n(h->faces_by_fd) != h->nfds) {
05215         h->nfds = hashtb_n(h->faces_by_fd);
05216         h->fds = realloc(h->fds, h->nfds * sizeof(h->fds[0]));
05217         memset(h->fds, 0, h->nfds * sizeof(h->fds[0]));
05218     }
05219     for (i = 0, k = h->nfds, hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e);
05220          i < k && e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
05221         struct face *face = e->data;
05222         if (face->flags & CCN_FACE_MCAST)
05223             j = i++;
05224         else
05225             j = --k;
05226         h->fds[j].fd = face->recv_fd;
05227         h->fds[j].events = ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_NORECV) == 0) ? POLLIN : 0;
05228         if ((face->outbuf != NULL || (face->flags & CCN_FACE_CLOSING) != 0))
05229             h->fds[j].events |= POLLOUT;
05230     }
05231     hashtb_end(e);
05232     if (i < k)
05233         abort();
05234 }
05235 
05236 /**
05237  * Run the main loop of the ccnd
05238  */
05239 void
05240 ccnd_run(struct ccnd_handle *h)
05241 {
05242     int i;
05243     int res;
05244     int timeout_ms = -1;
05245     int prev_timeout_ms = -1;
05246     int usec;
05247     for (h->running = 1; h->running;) {
05248         process_internal_client_buffer(h);
05249         usec = ccn_schedule_run(h->sched);
05250         timeout_ms = (usec < 0) ? -1 : ((usec + 960) / 1000);
05251         if (timeout_ms == 0 && prev_timeout_ms == 0)
05252             timeout_ms = 1;
05253         process_internal_client_buffer(h);
05254         prepare_poll_fds(h);
05255         if (0) ccnd_msg(h, "at ccnd.c:%d poll(h->fds, %d, %d)", __LINE__, h->nfds, timeout_ms);
05256         res = poll(h->fds, h->nfds, timeout_ms);
05257         prev_timeout_ms = ((res == 0) ? timeout_ms : 1);
05258         if (-1 == res) {
05259             ccnd_msg(h, "poll: %s (errno = %d)", strerror(errno), errno);
05260             sleep(1);
05261             continue;
05262         }
05263         if (res > 0) {
05264             /* we need a fresh current time for setting interest expiries */
05265             struct ccn_timeval dummy;
05266             h->ticktock.gettime(&h->ticktock, &dummy);
05267         }
05268         for (i = 0; res > 0 && i < h->nfds; i++) {
05269             if (h->fds[i].revents != 0) {
05270                 res--;
05271                 if (h->fds[i].revents & (POLLERR | POLLNVAL | POLLHUP)) {
05272                     if (h->fds[i].revents & (POLLIN))
05273                         process_input(h, h->fds[i].fd);
05274                     else
05275                         shutdown_client_fd(h, h->fds[i].fd);
05276                     continue;
05277                 }
05278                 if (h->fds[i].revents & (POLLOUT))
05279                     do_deferred_write(h, h->fds[i].fd);
05280                 else if (h->fds[i].revents & (POLLIN))
05281                     process_input(h, h->fds[i].fd);
05282             }
05283         }
05284     }
05285 }
05286 
05287 /**
05288  * Reseed our pseudo-random number generator.
05289  */
05290 static void
05291 ccnd_reseed(struct ccnd_handle *h)
05292 {
05293     int fd;
05294     ssize_t res;
05295     
05296     res = -1;
05297     fd = open("/dev/urandom", O_RDONLY);
05298     if (fd != -1) {
05299         res = read(fd, h->seed, sizeof(h->seed));
05300         close(fd);
05301     }
05302     if (res != sizeof(h->seed)) {
05303         h->seed[1] = (unsigned short)getpid(); /* better than no entropy */
05304         h->seed[2] = (unsigned short)time(NULL);
05305     }
05306     /*
05307      * The call to seed48 is needed by cygwin, and should be harmless
05308      * on other platforms.
05309      */
05310     seed48(h->seed);
05311 }
05312 
05313 /**
05314  * Get the name of our unix-domain socket listener.
05315  *
05316  * Uses the library to generate the name, using the environment.
05317  * @returns a newly-allocated nul-terminated string.
05318  */
05319 static char *
05320 ccnd_get_local_sockname(void)
05321 {
05322     struct sockaddr_un sa;
05323     ccn_setup_sockaddr_un(NULL, &sa);
05324     return(strdup(sa.sun_path));
05325 }
05326 
05327 /**
05328  * Get the time.
05329  *
05330  * This is used to supply the clock for our scheduled events.
05331  */
05332 static void
05333 ccnd_gettime(const struct ccn_gettime *self, struct ccn_timeval *result)
05334 {
05335     struct ccnd_handle *h = self->data;
05336     struct timeval now = {0};
05337     long int sdelta;
05338     int udelta;
05339     ccn_wrappedtime delta;
05340     
05341     gettimeofday(&now, 0);
05342     result->s = now.tv_sec;
05343     result->micros = now.tv_usec;
05344     sdelta = now.tv_sec - h->sec;
05345     udelta = now.tv_usec + h->sliver - h->usec;
05346     h->sec = now.tv_sec;
05347     h->usec = now.tv_usec;
05348     while (udelta < 0) {
05349         udelta += 1000000;
05350         sdelta -= 1;
05351     }
05352     /* avoid letting time run backwards or taking huge steps */
05353     if (sdelta < 0)
05354         delta = 1;
05355     else if (sdelta >= (1U << 30) / WTHZ)
05356         delta = (1U << 30) / WTHZ;
05357     else {
05358         delta = (unsigned)udelta / (1000000U / WTHZ);
05359         h->sliver = udelta - delta * (1000000U / WTHZ);
05360         delta += (unsigned)sdelta * WTHZ;
05361     }
05362     h->wtnow += delta;
05363 }
05364 
05365 /**
05366  * Set IPV6_V6ONLY on a socket.
05367  *
05368  * The handle is used for error reporting.
05369  */
05370 void
05371 ccnd_setsockopt_v6only(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd)
05372 {
05373     int yes = 1;
05374     int res = 0;
05375 #ifdef IPV6_V6ONLY
05376     res = setsockopt(fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_V6ONLY, &yes, sizeof(yes));
05377 #endif
05378     if (res == -1)
05379         ccnd_msg(h, "warning - could not set IPV6_V6ONLY on fd %d: %s",
05380                  fd, strerror(errno));
05381 }
05382 
05383 /**
05384  * Translate an address family constant to a string.
05385  */
05386 static const char *
05387 af_name(int family)
05388 {
05389     switch (family) {
05390         case AF_INET:
05391             return("ipv4");
05392         case AF_INET6:
05393             return("ipv6");
05394         default:
05395             return("");
05396     }
05397 }
05398 
05399 /**
05400  * Create the standard ipv4 and ipv6 bound ports.
05401  */
05402 static int
05403 ccnd_listen_on_wildcards(struct ccnd_handle *h)
05404 {
05405     int fd;
05406     int res;
05407     int whichpf;
05408     struct addrinfo hints = {0};
05409     struct addrinfo *addrinfo = NULL;
05410     struct addrinfo *a;
05411     
05412     hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
05413     hints.ai_flags = AI_PASSIVE;
05414     for (whichpf = 0; whichpf < 2; whichpf++) {
05415         hints.ai_family = whichpf ? PF_INET6 : PF_INET;
05416         res = getaddrinfo(NULL, h->portstr, &hints, &addrinfo);
05417         if (res == 0) {
05418             for (a = addrinfo; a != NULL; a = a->ai_next) {
05419                 fd = socket(a->ai_family, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
05420                 if (fd != -1) {
05421                     struct face *face = NULL;
05422                     int yes = 1;
05423                     int rcvbuf = 0;
05424                     socklen_t rcvbuf_sz;
05425                     setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof(yes));
05426                     rcvbuf_sz = sizeof(rcvbuf);
05427                     getsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, &rcvbuf, &rcvbuf_sz);
05428                     if (a->ai_family == AF_INET6)
05429                         ccnd_setsockopt_v6only(h, fd);
05430                     res = bind(fd, a->ai_addr, a->ai_addrlen);
05431                     if (res != 0) {
05432                         close(fd);
05433                         continue;
05434                     }
05435                     face = record_connection(h, fd,
05436                                              a->ai_addr, a->ai_addrlen,
05437                                              CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE);
05438                     if (face == NULL) {
05439                         close(fd);
05440                         continue;
05441                     }
05442                     if (a->ai_family == AF_INET)
05443                         h->ipv4_faceid = face->faceid;
05444                     else
05445                         h->ipv6_faceid = face->faceid;
05446                     ccnd_msg(h, "accepting %s datagrams on fd %d rcvbuf %d",
05447                              af_name(a->ai_family), fd, rcvbuf);
05448                 }
05449             }
05450             for (a = addrinfo; a != NULL; a = a->ai_next) {
05451                 fd = socket(a->ai_family, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
05452                 if (fd != -1) {
05453                     int yes = 1;
05454                     setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof(yes));
05455                     if (a->ai_family == AF_INET6)
05456                         ccnd_setsockopt_v6only(h, fd);
05457                     res = bind(fd, a->ai_addr, a->ai_addrlen);
05458                     if (res != 0) {
05459                         close(fd);
05460                         continue;
05461                     }
05462                     res = listen(fd, 30);
05463                     if (res == -1) {
05464                         close(fd);
05465                         continue;
05466                     }
05467                     record_connection(h, fd,
05468                                       a->ai_addr, a->ai_addrlen,
05469                                       CCN_FACE_PASSIVE);
05470                     ccnd_msg(h, "accepting %s connections on fd %d",
05471                              af_name(a->ai_family), fd);
05472                 }
05473             }
05474             freeaddrinfo(addrinfo);
05475         }
05476     }
05477     return(0);
05478 }
05479 
05480 /**
05481  * Create a tcp listener and a bound udp socket on the given address
05482  */
05483 static int
05484 ccnd_listen_on_address(struct ccnd_handle *h, const char *addr)
05485 {
05486     int fd;
05487     int res;
05488     struct addrinfo hints = {0};
05489     struct addrinfo *addrinfo = NULL;
05490     struct addrinfo *a;
05491     int ok = 0;
05492     
05493     ccnd_msg(h, "listen_on %s", addr);
05494     hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
05495     hints.ai_flags = AI_PASSIVE;
05496     res = getaddrinfo(addr, h->portstr, &hints, &addrinfo);
05497     if (res == 0) {
05498         for (a = addrinfo; a != NULL; a = a->ai_next) {
05499             fd = socket(a->ai_family, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
05500             if (fd != -1) {
05501                 struct face *face = NULL;
05502                 int yes = 1;
05503                 int rcvbuf = 0;
05504                 socklen_t rcvbuf_sz;
05505                 setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof(yes));
05506                 rcvbuf_sz = sizeof(rcvbuf);
05507                 getsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, &rcvbuf, &rcvbuf_sz);
05508                 if (a->ai_family == AF_INET6)
05509                     ccnd_setsockopt_v6only(h, fd);
05510                 res = bind(fd, a->ai_addr, a->ai_addrlen);
05511                 if (res != 0) {
05512                     close(fd);
05513                     continue;
05514                 }
05515                 face = record_connection(h, fd,
05516                                          a->ai_addr, a->ai_addrlen,
05517                                          CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE);
05518                 if (face == NULL) {
05519                     close(fd);
05520                     continue;
05521                 }
05522                 if (a->ai_family == AF_INET)
05523                     h->ipv4_faceid = face->faceid;
05524                 else
05525                     h->ipv6_faceid = face->faceid;
05526                 ccnd_msg(h, "accepting %s datagrams on fd %d rcvbuf %d",
05527                              af_name(a->ai_family), fd, rcvbuf);
05528                 ok++;
05529             }
05530         }
05531         for (a = addrinfo; a != NULL; a = a->ai_next) {
05532             fd = socket(a->ai_family, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
05533             if (fd != -1) {
05534                 int yes = 1;
05535                 setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof(yes));
05536                 if (a->ai_family == AF_INET6)
05537                     ccnd_setsockopt_v6only(h, fd);
05538                 res = bind(fd, a->ai_addr, a->ai_addrlen);
05539                 if (res != 0) {
05540                     close(fd);
05541                     continue;
05542                 }
05543                 res = listen(fd, 30);
05544                 if (res == -1) {
05545                     close(fd);
05546                     continue;
05547                 }
05548                 record_connection(h, fd,
05549                                   a->ai_addr, a->ai_addrlen,
05550                                   CCN_FACE_PASSIVE);
05551                 ccnd_msg(h, "accepting %s connections on fd %d",
05552                          af_name(a->ai_family), fd);
05553                 ok++;
05554             }
05555         }
05556         freeaddrinfo(addrinfo);
05557     }
05558     return(ok > 0 ? 0 : -1);
05559 }
05560 
05561 /**
05562  * Create listeners or bound udp ports using the given addresses
05563  *
05564  * The addresses may be separated by whitespace, commas, or semicolons.
05565  */
05566 static int
05567 ccnd_listen_on(struct ccnd_handle *h, const char *addrs)
05568 {
05569     unsigned char ch;
05570     unsigned char dlm;
05571     int res = 0;
05572     int i;
05573     struct ccn_charbuf *addr = NULL;
05574     
05575     if (addrs == NULL || !*addrs || 0 == strcmp(addrs, "*"))
05576         return(ccnd_listen_on_wildcards(h));
05577     addr = ccn_charbuf_create();
05578     for (i = 0, ch = addrs[i]; addrs[i] != 0;) {
05579         addr->length = 0;
05580         dlm = 0;
05581         if (ch == '[') {
05582             dlm = ']';
05583             ch = addrs[++i];
05584         }
05585         for (; ch > ' ' && ch != ',' && ch != ';' && ch != dlm; ch = addrs[++i])
05586             ccn_charbuf_append_value(addr, ch, 1);
05587         if (ch && ch == dlm)
05588             ch = addrs[++i];
05589         if (addr->length > 0) {
05590             res |= ccnd_listen_on_address(h, ccn_charbuf_as_string(addr));
05591         }
05592         while ((0 < ch && ch <= ' ') || ch == ',' || ch == ';')
05593             ch = addrs[++i];
05594     }
05595     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&addr);
05596     return(res);
05597 }
05598 
05599 /**
05600  * Parse a list of ccnx URIs
05601  *
05602  * The URIs may be separated by whitespace, commas, or semicolons.
05603  *
05604  * Errors are logged.
05605  *
05606  * @returns a newly-allocated charbuf containing nul-terminated URIs; or
05607  *          NULL if no valid URIs are found.
05608  */
05609 static struct ccn_charbuf *
05610 ccnd_parse_uri_list(struct ccnd_handle *h, const char *what, const char *uris)
05611 {
05612     struct ccn_charbuf *ans;
05613     struct ccn_charbuf *name;
05614     int i;
05615     size_t j;
05616     int res;
05617     unsigned char ch;
05618     const char *uri;
05619 
05620     if (uris == NULL)
05621         return(NULL);
05622     ans = ccn_charbuf_create();
05623     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
05624     for (i = 0, ch = uris[0]; ch != 0;) {
05625         while ((0 < ch && ch <= ' ') || ch == ',' || ch == ';')
05626             ch = uris[++i];
05627         j = ans->length;
05628         while (ch > ' ' && ch != ',' && ch != ';') {
05629             ccn_charbuf_append_value(ans, ch, 1);
05630             ch = uris[++i];
05631         }
05632         if (j < ans->length) {
05633             ccn_charbuf_append_value(ans, 0, 1);
05634             uri = (const char *)ans->buf + j;
05635             name->length = 0;
05636             res = ccn_name_from_uri(name, uri);
05637             if (res < 0) {
05638                 ccnd_msg(h, "%s: invalid ccnx URI: %s", what, uri);
05639                 ans->length = j;
05640             }
05641         }
05642     }
05643     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
05644     if (ans->length == 0)
05645         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&ans);
05646     return(ans);
05647 }
05648 
05649 /**
05650  * Start a new ccnd instance
05651  * @param progname - name of program binary, used for locating helpers
05652  * @param logger - logger function
05653  * @param loggerdata - data to pass to logger function
05654  */
05655 struct ccnd_handle *
05656 ccnd_create(const char *progname, ccnd_logger logger, void *loggerdata)
05657 {
05658     char *sockname;
05659     const char *portstr;
05660     const char *debugstr;
05661     const char *entrylimit;
05662     const char *mtu;
05663     const char *data_pause;
05664     const char *tts_default;
05665     const char *tts_limit;
05666     const char *autoreg;
05667     const char *listen_on;
05668     int fd;
05669     struct ccnd_handle *h;
05670     struct hashtb_param param = {0};
05671     
05672     sockname = ccnd_get_local_sockname();
05673     h = calloc(1, sizeof(*h));
05674     if (h == NULL)
05675         return(h);
05676     h->logger = logger;
05677     h->loggerdata = loggerdata;
05678     h->noncegen = &ccnd_plain_nonce;
05679     h->logpid = (int)getpid();
05680     h->progname = progname;
05681     h->debug = -1;
05682     h->skiplinks = ccn_indexbuf_create();
05683     param.finalize_data = h;
05684     h->face_limit = 1024; /* soft limit */
05685     h->faces_by_faceid = calloc(h->face_limit, sizeof(h->faces_by_faceid[0]));
05686     param.finalize = &finalize_face;
05687     h->faces_by_fd = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct face), &param);
05688     h->dgram_faces = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct face), &param);
05689     param.finalize = 0;
05690     h->faceid_by_guid = hashtb_create(sizeof(unsigned), &param);
05691     param.finalize = &finalize_content;
05692     h->content_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct content_entry), &param);
05693     param.finalize = &finalize_nameprefix;
05694     h->nameprefix_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct nameprefix_entry), &param);
05695     param.finalize = &finalize_interest;
05696     h->interest_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct interest_entry), &param);
05697     param.finalize = &finalize_guest;
05698     h->guest_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct guest_entry), &param);
05699     param.finalize = 0;
05700     h->sparse_straggler_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct sparse_straggler_entry), NULL);
05701     h->min_stale = ~0;
05702     h->max_stale = 0;
05703     h->send_interest_scratch = ccn_charbuf_create();
05704     h->unsol = ccn_indexbuf_create();
05705     h->ticktock.descr[0] = 'C';
05706     h->ticktock.micros_per_base = 1000000;
05707     h->ticktock.gettime = &ccnd_gettime;
05708     h->ticktock.data = h;
05709     h->sched = ccn_schedule_create(h, &h->ticktock);
05710     h->starttime = h->sec;
05711     h->starttime_usec = h->usec;
05712     h->wtnow = 0xFFFF0000; /* provoke a rollover early on */
05713     h->oldformatcontentgrumble = 1;
05714     h->oldformatinterestgrumble = 1;
05715     debugstr = getenv("CCND_DEBUG");
05716     if (debugstr != NULL && debugstr[0] != 0) {
05717         h->debug = atoi(debugstr);
05718         if (h->debug == 0 && debugstr[0] != '0')
05719             h->debug = 1;
05720     }
05721     else
05722         h->debug = 1;
05723     portstr = getenv(CCN_LOCAL_PORT_ENVNAME);
05724     if (portstr == NULL || portstr[0] == 0 || strlen(portstr) > 10)
05725         portstr = CCN_DEFAULT_UNICAST_PORT;
05726     h->portstr = portstr;
05727     entrylimit = getenv("CCND_CAP");
05728     h->capacity = ~0;
05729     if (entrylimit != NULL && entrylimit[0] != 0) {
05730         h->capacity = atol(entrylimit);
05731         if (h->capacity == 0)
05732             h->force_zero_freshness = 1;
05733         if (h->capacity <= 0)
05734             h->capacity = 10;
05735     }
05736     ccnd_msg(h, "CCND_DEBUG=%d CCND_CAP=%lu", h->debug, h->capacity);
05737     h->mtu = 0;
05738     mtu = getenv("CCND_MTU");
05739     if (mtu != NULL && mtu[0] != 0) {
05740         h->mtu = atol(mtu);
05741         if (h->mtu < 0)
05742             h->mtu = 0;
05743         if (h->mtu > 8800)
05744             h->mtu = 8800;
05745     }
05746     h->data_pause_microsec = 10000;
05747     data_pause = getenv("CCND_DATA_PAUSE_MICROSEC");
05748     if (data_pause != NULL && data_pause[0] != 0) {
05749         h->data_pause_microsec = atol(data_pause);
05750         if (h->data_pause_microsec == 0)
05751             h->data_pause_microsec = 1;
05752         if (h->data_pause_microsec > 1000000)
05753             h->data_pause_microsec = 1000000;
05754     }
05755     h->tts_default = -1;
05756     tts_default = getenv("CCND_DEFAULT_TIME_TO_STALE");
05757     if (tts_default != NULL && tts_default[0] != 0) {
05758         h->tts_default = atoi(tts_default);
05759         if (h->tts_default <= 0)
05760             h->tts_default = -1;
05761         ccnd_msg(h, "CCND_DEFAULT_TIME_TO_STALE=%d", h->tts_default);
05762     }
05763     h->tts_limit = ~0U;
05764     tts_limit = getenv("CCND_MAX_TIME_TO_STALE");
05765     if (tts_limit != NULL && tts_limit[0] != 0) {
05766         h->tts_limit = atoi(tts_limit);
05767         if (h->tts_limit <= 0)
05768             h->tts_limit = -1;
05769         else if (h->tts_limit > ((1U<<31) / 1000000))
05770             h->tts_limit = (1U<<31) / 1000000;
05771         ccnd_msg(h, "CCND_MAX_TIME_TO_STALE=%d", h->tts_limit);
05772     }
05773     listen_on = getenv("CCND_LISTEN_ON");
05774     autoreg = getenv("CCND_AUTOREG");
05775     
05776     if (autoreg != NULL && autoreg[0] != 0) {
05777         h->autoreg = ccnd_parse_uri_list(h, "CCND_AUTOREG", autoreg);
05778         if (h->autoreg != NULL)
05779             ccnd_msg(h, "CCND_AUTOREG=%s", autoreg);
05780     }
05781     if (listen_on != NULL && listen_on[0] != 0)
05782         ccnd_msg(h, "CCND_LISTEN_ON=%s", listen_on);
05783     // if (h->debug & 256)
05784         h->noncegen = &ccnd_debug_nonce;
05785     /* Do keystore setup early, it takes a while the first time */
05786     ccnd_init_internal_keystore(h);
05787     ccnd_reseed(h);
05788     if (h->face0 == NULL) {
05789         struct face *face;
05790         face = calloc(1, sizeof(*face));
05791         face->recv_fd = -1;
05792         face->sendface = 0;
05793         face->flags = (CCN_FACE_GG | CCN_FACE_LOCAL);
05794         h->face0 = face;
05795     }
05796     enroll_face(h, h->face0);
05797     fd = create_local_listener(h, sockname, 42);
05798     if (fd == -1)
05799         ccnd_msg(h, "%s: %s", sockname, strerror(errno));
05800     else
05801         ccnd_msg(h, "listening on %s", sockname);
05802     h->flood = (h->autoreg != NULL);
05803     h->ipv4_faceid = h->ipv6_faceid = CCN_NOFACEID;
05804     ccnd_listen_on(h, listen_on);
05805     reap_needed(h, 55000);
05806     age_forwarding_needed(h);
05807     ccnd_internal_client_start(h);
05808     free(sockname);
05809     sockname = NULL;
05810     return(h);
05811 }
05812 
05813 /**
05814  * Shutdown listeners and bound datagram sockets, leaving connected streams.
05815  */
05816 static void
05817 ccnd_shutdown_listeners(struct ccnd_handle *h)
05818 {
05819     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
05820     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
05821     for (hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e); e->data != NULL;) {
05822         struct face *face = e->data;
05823         if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_MCAST | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE)) != 0)
05824             hashtb_delete(e);
05825         else
05826             hashtb_next(e);
05827     }
05828     hashtb_end(e);
05829 }
05830 
05831 /**
05832  * Destroy the ccnd instance, releasing all associated resources.
05833  */
05834 void
05835 ccnd_destroy(struct ccnd_handle **pccnd)
05836 {
05837     struct ccnd_handle *h = *pccnd;
05838     if (h == NULL)
05839         return;
05840     ccnd_shutdown_listeners(h);
05841     ccnd_internal_client_stop(h);
05842     ccn_schedule_destroy(&h->sched);
05843     hashtb_destroy(&h->dgram_faces);
05844     hashtb_destroy(&h->faces_by_fd);
05845     hashtb_destroy(&h->faceid_by_guid);
05846     hashtb_destroy(&h->content_tab);

05848     hashtb_destroy(&h->nameprefix_tab);
05849     hashtb_destroy(&h->sparse_straggler_tab);
05850     hashtb_destroy(&h->guest_tab);
05851     if (h->fds != NULL) {
05852         free(h->fds);
05853         h->fds = NULL;
05854         h->nfds = 0;
05855     }
05856     if (h->faces_by_faceid != NULL) {
05857         free(h->faces_by_faceid);
05858         h->faces_by_faceid = NULL;
05859         h->face_limit = h->face_gen = 0;
05860     }
05861     if (h->content_by_accession != NULL) {
05862         free(h->content_by_accession);

05864         h->content_by_accession_window = 0;
05865     }
05866     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->send_interest_scratch);

05868     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->autoreg);
05869     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->skiplinks);
05870     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->scratch_indexbuf);
05871     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->unsol);
05872     if (h->face0 != NULL) {
05873         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->face0->inbuf);
05874         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->face0->outbuf);
05875         free(h->face0);

05879     *pccnd = NULL;
